起動時システムメッセージ
[ff0000]ATTENTION![-] You are playing an [c][ff0000]OUTDATED[-][/c] build of Yandere Simulator! A new build is available for download at: \n \n yanderedev.wordpress.com=[ff0000]注意！[-] このビルドは最新バージョンではありません！ 新しいバージョンは以下のリンクからダウンロードできます \n \n yanderedev.wordpress.com
You are playing one of the first releases of 1980s Mode. There might be some bugs in this build!\n\nIf you encounter a bug, please check YandereDev's blog to learn if you can download a new build where the bug is fixed.=あなたがプレイしているのは、1980年代モードの初期のリリースの一つです。このビルドにはいくつかのバグがあるかもしれません。バグが発生した場合は、YandereDevのブログで、バグが修正された新しいビルドをダウンロードできるかどうかを確認してください。
If you encounter a bug, a new build may be available where the bug is already fixed. Please check YandereDev's blog to learn what bugs have been fixed recently.\n\nyanderedev.wordpress.com=バグを見つけた場合、最新ビルドで既に修正されている可能性があります。バグ修正の履歴はYandereDevのブログで確認できます。\n\nyanderedev.wordpress.com

デモ警告文&クレジット
Yandere Simulator is the type of game that is periodically updated with new content over time.=Yandere Simulatorは、継続的にコンテンツが追加されるタイプのゲームです。
You may encounter bugs or unfinished features.=バグや未完成の機能が存在します。
Some of the current models and animations are placeholders.=現在のモデルやアニメーションはプレースホルダです。
The game's performance and framerate will continuously be improved throughout development.=ゲームのパフォーマンスとフレームレートは開発中に継続的に改善されます。
Some models and animations are placeholders.=いくつかのモデルとアニメーションは代替品です。
You will not be able to access debug commands or easter eggs until you have beaten the demo at least once.=最低一回デモをクリアするまで、デバッグコマンドやイースターエッグにアクセスすることはできません。
All characters depicted are 18 or older, even if otherwise specified.=このゲームに登場する全てのキャラクターは18歳以上です。
A small number of features are missing or unfinished.=一部の機能が未実装であったり不完全です。
This build of the game is a demo.=このゲームのビルドはデモです。
Press any button to begin!=ボタンを押して開始！
Welcome to Yandere Simulator!=Yandere Simulatorへようこそ！
The developer of this game does not endorse violence in schools.=このゲームの開発者は学校での暴力を支持しません。
This game contains violent content, and is not appropriate for children.=このゲームには暴力的なコンテンツが含まれており、子供には適していません。

Modding Tools=MODツール
Type the word "debug" while you're at school to unlock debug commands and easter eggs!=デバッグコマンドとイースターエッグを解放するには、学校で「debug」と入力してください！
While you're on this screen, press the "P" key to load the Portrait Scene.\n\nIt will take a long time to load, and the game's resolution will change.\n\nFrom that screen, press the "ESC" key to return to this scene.=この画面でPキーを押すと顔写真用のシーンを読み込みます。\n\n読み込みには時間がかかり、画面の解像度も変更されます。\n\n読み込み画面でESCキーを押せばこの画面に戻ります。

Difficulty Options=　　難易度オプション
Your Difficulty:=難しさ：
Baby Mode=ベイビー
Very Easy Mode=超簡単
Easy Mode=簡単
Normal Mode=普通
Hard Mode=難しい
Very Hard Mode=ゲキムズ
Nightmare Mode=悪夢
Yandere Mode=ヤンデレ

EASIER=イージー
It is possible to fight Raibaru after upgrading the Physical Education stat once.=体育ランクが1以上なら、Raibaruと戦うことができる。
The player will receive a "weapon case" for free at the start of the game.=武器が入る大きめのカバンが、ゲーム開始時に容易に入手できる。
Students cannot see through the chain-link fence in the incinerator area.=生徒たちは、焼却炉エリアのフェンスの向こう側を見ることができない。
Any blunt weapons can perform bloodless stealth kills.=鈍器で返り血を浴びずにステルスキルできる。
A bucket of water can be used to create a trap.=バケツの水を使って罠を作成できる。
Garbage bags can be used as bodybags.=ゴミ袋で死体を包むことができる。
Weapons cannot break.=武器が壊れない。

HARDER=ハード
It is not possible to engage in a physical struggle with Raibaru.=Raibaruとつかみ合いで勝負することができない。
The player must join the Light Music Club or Delinquent gang to obtain a "weapon case."=武器が入る大きめのカバンを入手するためには、軽音部か不良になる必要がある。
Students can see through the chain-link fence in the incinerator area.=生徒たちは、焼却炉エリアのフェンスの向こう側を見ることができる。
Only strangulation weapons can perform bloodless stealth kills.=返り血を浴びずにステルスキルできるのは、絞殺武器だけ。
The player must fill a bucket with brown paint, blood, or gasoline in order to create a trap.=罠を作成するためには、茶色の塗料、血液、ガソリンのいずれかをバケツに入れる必要がある。
Garbage bags must be crafted into bodybags.=ゴミ袋を死体袋にクラフトしないと、死体を包むことができない。
Small weapons break after one use.=小さな武器は一度使用すると壊れる。

チェックリスト
Are you ABSOLUTELY CERTAIN that you want to reset your Demo Checklist progress?\n\nMash the Confirm button 10 times to reaffirm this decision.=本当にチェックリストを\nリセットしますか？\n\n削除する場合は\n決定ボタンを10回押してください。
This is a hidden debug command for completely removing all Yandere Simulator data from your computer's registry. This command will delete all of your save data, but may fix certain types of bugs that cannot be fixed in any other way.=これはYandere Simulatorのすべてのデータをレジストリから削除する隠しコマンドです。このコマンドは全データを消去するので、他の方法では修正できないバグを修正できる場合があります。
Attack Elimination=物理排除
Kill a rival by directly attacking her with a weapon.=恋敵を武器で直接殺害する
Befriend Elimination=友情排除
Solve a rival's personal problems and then befriend her in your home.=恋敵の問題を解決し、自宅で恋敵と親友になる
Betray Elimination=裏切り排除
Solve a rival's personal problem and then drug her tea in your home.=恋敵の問題を解決し、自宅で恋敵に睡眠薬を盛る
Bully Elimination=いじめ排除
Gossip about a rival to lower her reputation until she no longer attends school.=恋敵の評判を下げ、自主退学させる
Burn Elimination=焼死排除
Use gasoline and a candle to set a rival on fire.=ガソリンとろうそくを使って恋敵を燃やす
Crush Elimination=クラッシュ排除
Drop a heavy object on a rival's head from above.=恋敵の頭の上に重いものを落とす
Drop a bucket full of heavy weights on a rival's head from above.=屋上から恋敵の頭の上に重石を入れたバケツを落とす
Drown Elimination=溺死排除
Drown a rival in a toilet bowl or at the fountain in the school plaza.=トイレや中庭の噴水で恋敵を溺死させる
Electrocute Elimination=感電死排除
Electrocute a rival using an electrified puddle of water.=通電した水溜まりを作り恋敵を感電死させる
Pool Elimination=プール排除
Tie a rival's hair around a heavy weight and push it into the school pool.=恋敵の髪に重りを括り付け、プールに沈める
Weapon Master=ウェポンマスター
Equip 20 different types of weapons.=20個の武器を装備する
Rich Girl=リッチガール
Amass over $1,000.=1,000ドル以上所持する
Poison Elimination=毒殺排除
Poison the food that a rival will eat for lunch.=恋敵の昼食に致死毒を盛る
Murder Suicide Elimination=心中排除
Command a mind-broken slave to kill a rival.=洗脳した生徒に恋敵との心中させる
Panty Queen=パンティークイーン
Collect all 10 panties.=10種類の下着を集める
Head Hunter=ヘッドハンター
Dismember at least 10 students.=10人以上の死体を解体する
Matchmake Elimination=マッチメイク排除
Get a rival to fall for another boy other than Senpai.=恋敵をセンパイ以外の男子と恋仲にする
Kidnap Elimination=誘拐排除
Tranquilize a rival in the gym storage room and kidnap her.=体育倉庫で恋敵を眠らせて誘拐する
Drive-To-Murder Elimination=殺人教唆排除
Drive a student to murder a rival, without kidnapping or mind-breaking.=誘拐や洗脳をせずに、誰かに恋敵を殺害させる
Suicide Elimination=自殺排除
Gossip about a rival to lower her reputation until she ends her own life.=恋敵の評判を下げて自殺に追い込む
Frame Elimination=冤罪排除
Commit a murder and then trick a rival into putting her fingerprints on the murder weapon.=恋敵の指紋を付けた凶器で殺人し、濡れ衣を着せる
Fan Elimination=換気扇排除
Shove a rival's head into the whirling fan blades of a ventilation unit.=屋上の換気扇に恋敵の髪を巻き込ませる
Reject Elimination=失恋排除
Sabotage all of a rival's interactions with Senpai to make him reject her love confession.=センパイへのアプローチを妨害し、告白を失敗させる
Push Elimination=落下死排除
Push a rival off the school rooftop.=恋敵を屋上から突き落とす
Expel Elimination=退学排除
Get a rival expelled from school by framing her for breaking school rules.=恋敵の校則違反を捏造し退学させる
Alphabet Killer Challenge=アルファベットキラーチャレンジ
Type "A B C D E F G" while in your room at home, and complete any difficulty level of the "Alphabet Killer Challenge."=自室でABCDEFGとキー入力、「アルファベットキラーチャレンジ」を難易度問わず達成。
Amai Eliminated=Amai排除
Eliminate Amai using any elimination method.=Amaiを何らかの方法で排除する。
Eliminate Osana, and then, on the subsequent week, eliminate Amai and dispose of her corpse without alarming anyone.=Osanaを排除した次の週、誰にも警戒されずにAmaiを排除し、死体を処分する。
Dance Machine Minigame=ダンスマシン ミニゲーム
Complete any song on the Dance Machine Minigame inside of the Anime and Gaming Club.=ゲーム部室内のダンスマシンで1曲クリアする。
Genocide Ending=ジェノサイドエンド
Achieve the "Genocide Ending" by killing everyone in school on the first day of the game.=学校初日に全員殺して「ジェノサイドエンド」達成。
Listen to all of the cassette tapes that the headmaster threw into a garbage can in his office.=校長がゴミ箱に捨てたカセットテープをすべて聴く。
Listen to all of the "Mysterious Tapes" that have been scattered around the school.=校内に散らばっている「謎のテープ」をすべて聴く。
Journalist Tapes=ジャーナリストのテープ
Life Note Anime=ライフノートのアニメ
Watch the "Life Note" anime episode that can be accessed inside of Ayano's room at home.=Ayanoの部屋で「ライフノート」のアニメを観る。
Maid Cafe Minigame=メイドカフェ ミニゲーム
Complete a shift at the Maid Cafe that is accessible by going to town at night.=夜の商店街でメイドカフェのバイトをクリアする。
Create a Mission Mode mission that has a difficulty level of "10" and complete the mission successfully.=ミッションモードで難易度が10のミッションを選んでクリア。
Complete the Magical Girl Pretty Miyuki minigame that can be played on the video game console in Ayano's room at home.=Ayanoの自室のゲーム機で魔法少女プリティみゆきのミニゲームをクリア。
Listen to all of the cassette tapes that can be found in Ayano's basement.=Ayanoの家の地下室にあるカセットテープをすべて聴く。
Light Music Club Rhythm Minigame=軽音部のリズムミニゲーム
Join the Light Music Club, speak to the club leader about "Practice," and complete the "Panther" rhythm minigame.=軽音部に入部後、部長に話しかけて「練習」で「Panther」のリズムミニゲームをクリア。
Have 5 conversations with Selene2005 by using Ayano's computer to access "Yancord" at night.=AyanoのPCから「Yancord」に入ってSelene2005と5回話す。
SNAP Mode=SNAP モード
Get a "HEARTBROKEN" game over, access the "SNAP" command, and see SNAP Mode through to its completion.=「HEARTBROKEN」のゲームオーバーで「SNAP」を選んで最期まで殺る。
A delinquent boy in 1980s Mode will ask you to beat up some hooligans. Complete his request, and then speak to the shady man in the alleyway in town.=1980年代モードの不良男子の1人の頼みでチンピラを撃退。そのあと商店街の脇道にいる怪しい男と話す。
Recieve a copy of Yanvania from Pippi Osu, play it on the console in Ayano's home, and defeat Dracula-chan.=Pippi Osuから「悪魔城ヤンデレ 月下の先輩」を受け取って、\nAyanoのゲーム機でプレイ、ドラキュラちゃんを撃破。

設定

Knife Only=ナイフ限定
You are only allowed to eliminate your rivals using short bladed weapons. Any other elimination method will result in a Game Over.=小さい刃物による攻撃以外で恋敵を排除できなくなります。別の方法で恋敵を排除するとゲームオーバーです。

You will recieve a Game Over if any student witnesses a corpse, a murder, or your suspicious behavior.=誰かに武器所持・殺人・不審行為を見られるとゲームオーバーになります。

Leave Cafe=メイド喫茶を出る
You can work a part-time job as a waitress at this maid cafe to earn money.\r\n \r\nThe amount of money you earn is dependent on the difficulty level you choose, and also how quickly you serve the customers.\r\n \r\nIf you ignore too many customers or serve the wrong dish too many times, you will not get paid.=メイド喫茶でバイトしてお金を稼ぐことができる。\r\n \r\n稼げる金額は難易度や給仕の速さで変わります。\r\n \r\nもしお客さんを無視しすぎたり、間違った料理を運びすぎると、お金は貰えません。

Yakuza=ヤクザ
Yakuza Services=裏取引
I'm not going to give you my name, and you're not going to give me yours. The less we know about each other, the better.=お前に名乗るつもりはないし、お前も名乗らなくていい。お互い知り過ぎない方がいいだろう。
As soon as we're done here, you're going to forget my face, and forget that this conversation ever happened. Got it?=ことが終われば俺の顔は忘れろ。俺らの間には何もなかった。いいな？
Understood.=わかったわ。
My brother owes you a debt that he could never repay. I'm grateful that you pulled his ass out of the fire. But...that doesn't make us friends.=お前には弟じゃ返せないほどの借りがある。弟を助けてくれたことにも感謝してる。だが、お前と親しくするつもりはない。
The less debts a man owes, the better...and I don't want my brother to owe anything to anyone.=借りがあると面倒だからな...\n弟には誰にも借りを作ってほしくない。
So, I'm here to make things square between you and him. This is strictly business...so let's cut to the chase.=だから、弟の借りを返すためにここに来た。これは厳格なビジネスだ...さて、本題に入ろう。
I've brought some things with me that you might be interested in. Hurry up and pick the one that you want.=お前が興味を持ちそうな品をいくつか持ってきた。一つだけくれてやる。

There. You got what you wanted. With this, my brother's debt is cleared. Do we have an understanding?=ほらよ、お前の望んだ品だ。これで弟の借りは返した。いいな？
We do.=ええ。
Good. And if you're smart...this will be the last time you even *talk* to someone like me.=よし。お前が賢明なら、もう俺みたいな奴と「たわいもない雑談」をすることもないだろう。
...just...one thing. About my brother...I want you t...nevermind. Forget I said anything.=ただ...一つだけ。弟を...いや、なんでもない。今のは忘れてくれ。

I'll call in my favor another day.=また後日でいいかしら。
Tch...don't take forever to make up your mind. I might owe you, but my patience has limits.=チッ...さっさと決心してくれ。お前には借りがあるが、いつまでも待ってるわけにはいかん。

I'm ready to call in my favor now.=決心がついたわ。
Let's hear it, then.=では、聞かせて貰おう。

I'd like to work with you again.=またあなたと「お話」がしたいのだけど。
I thought I'd made myself clear. I only owed you *one* favor, and we're square now.=お前には確かに借りがあったが、既に返済したはずだ。そう言ったよな？
I'm not here to ask for a favor. I'd like to pay for your services.=おねだりしに来たんじゃない。代金は支払うわ。
You shouldn't get involved with people like me.=俺みたいな人間と関わるんじゃねえ。
I already am.=もう関わってるけど。
Hmph. If you're actually serious about this, you're going to need some pretty deep pockets.=ふむ...本気なら相当な金を頂くぞ。
You'd be surprised.=驚くと思うわよ。
We'll see about that. Here's the menu. And no, the prices are *not* up for negotiation.=それはどうかね。これがメニューだ。値切りは一切しないぞ。

RANSOM=身代金
Ransom=身代金
I'd like to propose a business deal.=取引したいのだけど。
Better not be a waste of my time.=時間の無駄にならなきゃいいがな。
I go to an elite school. My classmates belong to rich families. Families who wouldn't have a problem paying ransom money.=私は進学校に通ってる。クラスメートの殆どは家が裕福よ。身代金を払えるくらいにね。
...I'm listening.=...聞こうか。
If I kidnap a student from a rich family and bring them to you, would you pay me for them?=もし金持ちの生徒を誘拐してきたら、分け前をくれるかしら？
(scoff)...didn't see that one coming. Do you even realize what you're saying? Do you have any idea how risky that would be?=おいおい...そうくるとは思わなかったな。自分の言ってることが分かってるのか？随分危ない橋を渡るじゃないか。
...but, if you could actually pull it off...hmm. It certainly would be lucrative...=だが、成功すれば...ふむ、確かに儲かるな。
(sigh) I don't know why I'm sticking my neck out like this, but...alright. I'm in.=はぁ...なんでこんなことになっちまったのか...まあいいだろう。一枚嚙もう。
Normally, the Yakuza will pay you $1,000 to provide him with a kidnapped student. However, the Yakuza will pay more than $1,000 for the students below.=通常、生徒を誘拐すると10万円しか獲得できませんが、以下の生徒を誘拐するとそれ以上の分け前を貰えます。
Come back when you have a prisoner in your basement.=誰かを誘拐してまた来ましょう。
You currently have a prisoner in your basement.=地下に誘拐した生徒が居ます。

Come back after kidnapping one of these girls.=この中のいずれかの生徒を誘拐して来ましょう。
One of these girls is currently in your basement.=地下に対象の生徒がいます。
Some of these girls are currently in your basement.=地下に対象の生徒が複数人います。
Sell=売る

Congratulations on defeating your rival!\n\nIf you would like to advance the story, you can skip ahead using the button displayed at the bottom of the screen.\n\nOr, you can continue attending school to increase your stats, find collectibles, and make friends so that you will have more options in subsequent weeks.=恋敵の排除おめでとうございます！\n\nこの後のストーリーを見たい場合は画面下に表示されたボタンの通りに日付をスキップしてください。\n\nまた、学校に通ってステータスを上げたり、アイテムを見つけたり、友達を作ったりすることで、次の週からの選択肢が増えます。

地下室
Dear Ryoba,\r\n\r\nToday, I will be leaving Japan with no intention of returning.\r\n\r\nYou already know the reasons why.\r\n\r\nHowever, I could not bear the thought of leaving without speaking to my only friend one last time.\r\n\r\nPlease forgive this unorthodox method of getting into contact with you.\r\n\r\nMy father's men monitor my movements and communications very closely.\r\n\r\nEstablishing a secure way to communicate with you was very difficult, but I have done it.\r\n\r\nThere will be a brief window of opportunity that will allow us to speak without being monitored.\r\n\r\nI have timed the delivery of this postcard to coincide with that window.\r\n\r\nIf you wish to speak with me one last time, call this number immediately: 75-067-5708\r\n\r\nIn the event that we miss our brief opportunity and never speak again, I just wanted to say one thing:\r\n\r\nThank you for being my friend when no-one else would.\r\n\r\nSigned,\r\n\r\nIchiko Saikou\n\nJanuary 1st, 1990=Ryobaへ\r\n\r\n本日、日本を出る。帰国する予定はない。\r\n\r\n理由はもう知っているのだろう。\r\n\r\nしかし、最後にどうしても唯一の友人と話したかった。\r\n\r\nこんな方法で連絡することを許してほしい。\r\n\r\n父の部下の監視が厳しい。\r\n\r\n安全な連絡方法を確立することは非常に困難だったが、何とかなった。\r\n\r\n監視の目から逃れて話ができるのは、ほんの僅かな機会だ。\r\n\r\nこのハガキの配達はそのタイミングに合わせた。\r\n\r\n最後にもう一度私と話してくれるなら、すぐにこの番号に電話してほしい。75-067-5708\r\n\r\n万が一この機会を逃し、二度と話せないとしても、これだけは伝えさせてくれ。\r\n\r\n私の唯一の友でいてくれてありがとう。\r\n\r\nIchiko Saikouより\r\n\r\n1990年1月1日
Dear Ryoba,\r\n\r\nToday, I will be leaving Japan with no intention of returning.\r\n\r\nYou already know the reasons why.\r\n\r\nHowever, I could not bear the thought of leaving without speaking to my only friend one last time.\r\n\r\nPlease forgive this unorthodox method of getting into contact with you.\r\n\r\nMy father's men monitor my movements and communications very closely.\r\n\r\nEstablishing a secure way to communicate with you was very difficult, but I have done it.\r\n\r\nThere will be a brief window of opportunity that will allow us to speak without being monitored.\r\n\r\nI have timed the delivery of this postcard to coincide with that window.\r\n\r\nIf you wish to speak with me one last time, call this number immediately: 75-067-5708\r\n\r\nIn the event that we miss our brief opportunity and never speak again, I just wanted to say one thing:\r\n\r\nThank you for being my friend when no-one else would.\r\n\r\nSigned,\r\n\r\nIchikou Saikou\n\nJanuary 1st, 1990=Ryobaへ\r\n\r\n本日、日本を出る。帰国する予定はない。\r\n\r\n理由はもう知っているのだろう。\r\n\r\nしかし、最後にどうしても唯一の友人と話したかった。\r\n\r\nこんな方法で連絡することを許してほしい。\r\n\r\n父の部下の監視が厳しい。\r\n\r\n安全な連絡方法を確立することは非常に困難だったが、何とかなった。\r\n\r\n監視の目から逃れて話ができるのは、ほんの僅かな機会だ。\r\n\r\nこのハガキの配達はそのタイミングに合わせた。\r\n\r\n最後にもう一度私と話してくれるなら、すぐにこの番号に電話してほしい。75-067-5708\r\n\r\n万が一この機会を逃し、二度と話せないとしても、これだけは伝えさせてくれ。\r\n\r\n私の唯一の友でいてくれてありがとう。\r\n\r\nIchikou Saikouより\r\n\r\n1990年1月1日



r:"^Sanity:\s*(\d+(?:\.\d+)?)%$"=正気度: $1%
r:"^Health: (\d+)%$"=体力 :$1%
r:"^Meals: (\d+)$"=弁当: $1
Buy meals from the convenience store in town. Feed a prisoner a meal to restore 10% of their health.=商店街のコンビニで食料を購入しましょう。食料を与えると体力が10%回復します
Your prisoner has died. You should dispose of the body.=この生徒は死にました。死体を処分する必要があります。
Disposing of this corpse will take several hours. You will skip school to complete the task. Are you ready to dispose of the corpse now?=死体を処分するのには数時間かかります。学校をサボることになりますが、死体を処分しますか？
Disposing of this corpse will take several hours. You will go to sleep after completing the task. Are you ready to dispose of the corpse now?=死体を処分するのには数時間かかります。処分した後は就寝して次の日になりますが、死体を処分しますか？
You can't dispose of a corpse today. You need to go to school and eliminate your rival before she confesses to the boy you love.=今日は死体を処分できません。登校して恋敵がセンパイに告白する前に恋敵を排除する必要があります。
     Cassette Tape=　カセットテープ
     Record Video=    動画を撮影
r:"^Prisoner # (\d+)$"=囚人$1
Torture for 1 hour=1時間拷問
Torture for 4 hours=4時間拷問
Torture for 12 hours=12時間拷問
Torture for 18 hours=18時間拷問
Bring to School=学校に連れていく
If you torture your prisoner for 1 hour, you reduce their sanity by 2.5%, and will arrive at school one hour later than usual.=1時間拷問すると、正気度が2.5%減少し、登校が1時間遅れます。
If you torture your prisoner for 1 hour, you reduce their sanity by 2%, and will arrive at school one hour later than usual.=1時間拷問すると、正気度が2%減少し、登校が1時間遅れます。
If you torture your prisoner for 4 hours, you reduce their sanity by 8%.  You will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner.=4時間拷問すると、正気度が8%減少し、次の日になります。
If you torture your prisoner for 12 hours, you reduce their sanity by 24%, and will skip school for today. You will stop torturing your prisoner once night time arrives.=12時間拷問すると、正気度が24%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして夜になります。
If you torture your prisoner for 18 hours, you reduce their sanity by 36%, and will skip school for today. You will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner.=18時間拷問すると、正気度が36%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして次の日になります。
If you torture your prisoner for 1 hour, you will reduce her sanity by 2%, and you will arrive at school one hour later than usual.=1時間拷問すると、正気度が2%減少し、登校が1時間遅れます。
If you torture your prisoner for 4 hours, you will reduce her sanity by 8%, and you will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner.=4時間拷問すると、正気度が8%減少し、次の日になります。
If you torture your prisoner for 12 hours, you will reduce her sanity by 24%, and will skip school for today. You will stop torturing your prisoner once night time arrives.=12時間拷問すると、正気度が24%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして夜になります。
If you torture your prisoner for 18 hours, you will reduce her sanity by 36%, and will skip school for today. You will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner.=18時間拷問すると、正気度が36%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして次の日になります。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 1 hour, you reduce their sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%, and will arrive at school one hour later than usual\.$"=1時間拷問すると、正気度が${damage}%減少し、登校が1時間遅れます。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 4 hours, you reduce their sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%\.  You will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner\.$"=4時間拷問すると、正気度が${damage}%減少し、次の日になります。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 12 hours, you reduce their sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%, and will skip school for today\. You will stop torturing your prisoner once night time arrives\.$"=12時間拷問すると、正気度が${damage}%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして夜になります。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 18 hours, you reduce their sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%, and will skip school for today\. You will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner\.$"=18時間拷問すると、正気度が${damage}%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして次の日になります。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 1 hour, you will reduce her sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%, and you will arrive at school one hour later than usual\.$"=1時間拷問すると、対象の正気度が${damage}%減少し、登校が1時間遅れます。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 4 hours, you will reduce her sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%, and you will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner\.$"=4時間拷問すると、対象の正気度が${damage}%減少し、次の日になります。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 12 hours, you will reduce her sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%, and will skip school for today\. You will stop torturing your prisoner once night time arrives\.$"=12時間拷問すると、対象の正気度が${damage}%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして夜になります。
r:"^If you torture your prisoner for 18 hours, you will reduce her sanity by (?<damage>\d+)%, and will skip school for today\. You will go to sleep when you are done torturing your prisoner\.$"=18時間拷問すると、対象の正気度が${damage}%減少し、学校パートを飛ばして次の日になります。
This option is unavailable in the daytime.=日中はできません
This option is unavailable at nighttime.=夜間はできません
This option is unavailable on Friday.=金曜日はできません
This option is unavailable until your prisoner's Sanity has reached zero.=正気度が0でないとできません
If you bring your prisoner to school, you can put a weapon in her hand and instruct her to kill someone. Afterwards, she will kill herself.=学校に連れて行くと、武器を渡して誰かと心中させることができます。
Why are you doing this? What did I ever do to you?=なんでこんなことするの？私が何をしたっていうの？
How long are you going to keep me here? Forever?=いつまでこんなことが続くの？ずっと？
What are you going to do? Are you going to kill me?=何をするつもりなの？私を殺すの？
How could you do this to someone?=どうしてこんなことするの？
Could you at least put a TV in here? It's so boring...=せめてテレビでも置いてくれない？ホント退屈...

アニメ視聴
The young woman struggled to calm her trembling hands. She could barely maintain a grip on her pen.=女性は、震える手を必死に抑えていた。ペンを握るのがやっとだった。
"Steady, Yamiko...you can't afford to screw this up..."=「落ち着け、Yamiko...失敗は許されない...」
Once her pen touched the paper, she would only have 60 seconds to achieve her goal. That was one of the rules.=ペンが紙に触れてから、60秒以内に書き終えなければ。それが制約の一つなのだ。
She knew exactly what she wanted to write down. She had rehearsed it a dozen times on a spare scrap of paper. Each time, she just barely succeeded in finishing within 60 seconds.=何を書きたいのかは分かりきっていた。紙切れに何度も何度も書いてリハーサルをし、毎回60秒以内に書き終えていた。
"No more stalling...it's now or never."=「もう、後回しにはできない...今しかない。」
She took a deep breath, and began to write.=深呼吸をして、書き始めた。
"Asaka Seto will obtain a pipe wrench, a power strip, and a screwdriver."=「Asaka Setoはパイプレンチ、電源コード、ドライバーを手に入れる。」
"She will use the wrench to loosen the nearest water pipe and create a puddle of water."=「パイプレンチを使って近くの水道管を緩め、水たまりを作る。」
30 seconds remaining...her time was running out.=あと30秒...タイムリミットが迫ってきた。
"She will place a power strip in the puddle, and use the screwdriver to expose the wires."=「水溜まりの中に電源コードを置き、ドライバーで配線を露出させる。」
"Then, she will activate the power strip, and stand in the puddle."=「そして、電源コードに電気を通し、水たまりの中に立つ。」
The moment she finished writing, the ink on the notebook turned blood red. This meant that her 60 seconds were up - and it also meant that the command was in effect.=書き終えた瞬間、\nノートのインクが血のように赤くなった。\n60秒が経過し、指示が有効になった証だ。
Several kilometers away, at the Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department...=そのころ、数キロ離れた警視庁では...
A young policewoman, in the middle of a conversation with her colleagues, abruptly stopped talking and left the room.=同僚と話をしていた若い女性警官が、突然話を辞めて部屋を出て行った。
She walked to the nearest storage closet, and obtained a pipe wrench and a screwdriver.=近くの物置に行き、パイプレンチとドライバーを手に取った。
She carried out the actions that Yamiko had written in her notebook...=そして、\nYamikoが手帳に書いたことを実行に移した。
...and when she stepped into the puddle...=そして、水たまりに足を踏み入れて...
...she screamed in pain as thousands of volts of electricity ran through her body, fatally electrocuting her.=何千ボルトもの電気が体中に流れ、感電死した。
She was dead before her body hit the ground.=彼女は地面に倒れる前に息を引き取った。
"What have I done...?"=「やってしまった...」
It was the first time Yamiko had used the notebook to kill an innocent person.=Yamikoがノートで無実の人を殺したのは、これが初めてだった。
In the beginning, she only intended to use the notebook to rid the world of evil. She targeted violent criminals, child molesters, and so forth.=当初、彼女はノートで世界中の悪人を消すことだけを考えていた。ターゲットは、凶悪犯罪者や児童虐待犯などだった。
Dozens of mysterious deaths were too suspicious to be overlooked, and so an official police investigation had begun. Detective Seto had come too close to figuring out that Yamiko was the person responsible for the mysterious deaths.=しかし、数十件に及ぶ不審死を見過ごすことはできず、警察の捜査が始まった。Seto刑事は、その事件の犯人がYamikoであるという事実に気づく寸前であった。
"I'm not the bad guy here. She had to die. If I didn't kill her, she would have exposed me, and then I wouldn't be able to keep fighting evil..."=「私は悪くない。彼女には死んでもらう必要があった。殺さなければ、私の正体がバレ、悪と戦い続けることができなくなる...」
Yamiko felt as though the room was spinning around her. She desperately tried to convince herself that her actions were justified.=Yamikoは、部屋が回転しているような錯覚の中、お前のやったことは正しいんだと、必死に自分に言い聞かせていた。
"I did what I had to do. It was the only way to continue fighting evil. The world needs me. I need to keep using the notebook...because..."=「私はやるべきことをしたまでだ。悪と戦い続けるには、そうせざるを得なかった。世界には私が必要なのだ。私はノートを使い続けねば。なぜなら...」
"This world is a rotten mess."=「この世界は腐っている。」
"It really needs to be cleaned up."=「掃除が必要だ。」
Life Note Episode 7 - END=ライフノート 第7話 END

Keyboard:\n\nMove with the left and right arrow keys.\n\nRun by double-tapping the left/right arrow keys.\n\nCrouch by holding the down arrow key.\n\nAttack with the X key.\n\nJump with the Z key.=キーボード:\n\n矢印キー左右で移動\n\n矢印キー左右を2回連続押しで走る\n\n矢印キー下を押している間はしゃがむ\n\nXキーで攻撃\n\nZキーでジャンプ
Xbox Gamepad:\n\nMove with the left control stick.\n\nRun by double-tapping the left control stick.\n\nCrouch by holding down on the left control stick.\n\nAttack with the X Button.\n\nJump with the A Button.=Xboxコントローラー:\n\n左スティックで移動\n\n左スティックを2回連続で倒すと走る\n\n左スティックを下に倒している間はしゃがむ\n\nXボタンで攻撃\n\nAボタンでジャンプ
New Game=ニューゲーム
Final Stage:=Final Stage
"Heartbreak"=『失恋』
Beldere-chan=ベルデレちゃん
Dracula-chan=ドラキュラちゃん
Wilt thou try again?=もう一度やり直しますか?
Aye=はい
Nay=いいえ
The Akademi Institute is a boarding school that teaches magical arts to young men and women who have high potential for wizardry and witchcraft.\r\n\r\nOnce every one hundred years, under the glare of a full moon, the ghost of a long-dead succubus will appear within the Institute and beg one of the Institute's upperclassmen to resurrect her with a tribute of blood. If the succubus is resurrected, all of the school's students will vanish...except for any students who were in love with the upperclassman that resurrected the succubus.\r\n\r\nIf the succubus is not slain before the sun rises, the school's students will be forever lost, and the succubus' full power will be restored. The succubus can only be slain by a young woman who is in love with the upperclassman that revived the succubus.\r\n\r\nThe time has once again come for the forces of Love and Lust to engage in their ancient battle. The Institute beckons you...and no man can say who shall emerge victorious.=Akademi学園は、高い素質を持つ若き男女に魔法を教える寄宿学校である。\r\n\r\n百年に一度、満月の輝きの下で、太古の昔に滅びたサキュバスの亡霊が学園に現れ、上級生の一人に復活の為の血の貢物を求める。サキュバスが復活すれば、学園の生徒全員が消える...サキュバスを復活させた上級生に恋している生徒を除いて。\r\n\r\n日が昇る前にサキュバスを殺せなければ、学園の生徒は永遠に失われ、サキュバスが全ての力を取り戻す。サキュバスを殺せるのは、復活させた上級生に恋している若い女生徒だけである。\r\n\r\n愛と欲望の軍勢による古代の戦いが再開される時が来た。学園は貴方を手招きする...誰が勝利するか知る者はいない。
This disc is unreadable.\n\n1. Clean the disc with a soft cloth.\n2. Restart the console.\n\nFor more help, visit\nwww.saikoucorp.com/support.=ディスクを読み込めませんでした。\n\n1.柔らかい布でディスクを拭きます。\n2.ゲーム機本体を再起動します。\n\n詳細は下記のページをご覧下さい。\nwww.saikoucorp.com/support
Game Error=ゲームエラー
Push any button to exit the game.=ボタンを押してゲームを終了します。
Die, monster! You don't belong in this school! =滅びよ！ここは、お前の学校ではない！
It was not by my hand that I am once again given love.=私は自らの力で愛されるのではない。
It was not by my hand that I am once again given love. I\nwas called here by Senpai, who wished to pay me\ntribute. =私は自らの力で愛されるのではない。欲深なセンパイによって愛されるのよ。欲が唯一の愛なのだから。
Tribute!?! You steal boy's hearts, and make them your\nslaves! =それはお前の勝手な言い草だ！生徒は同じ信念のもとで求め合い、愛し、そして歩んで行く。
Perhaps the same could be said of all girls... =けど、現に生徒達は欲望によって求め合い、力によって統率されてきたじゃない。
Your words are as empty as your heart! Senpai ill needs a\ngirlfriend such as you! =生徒は欲だけでは恋愛できない。敬い、慈しむ心があるからこそ恋愛が出来るのだ。
What is a Senpai?=くだらない。
What is a Senpai? A miserable little pile of heartbreak!\nBut enough talk...have at you!=くだらない。どちらが正しいか、失恋をもって解らせてあげる。

みゆき

Yancord Server Notification=Yancordの通知があります
Ayano Aishi has joined the Moonlit Warrior Selene Fanserver.=Ayano Aishiが月光戦士セレーネファンサーバーに参加しました。
OMG hi!! You're the first person to join my server!!=ようこそ！うちのサーバーに来たのは君が初めてだよ！
I was getting worried that nobody would find this place...=誰も来ないんじゃないかと不安だったけど...
I'm so happy to meet another fan of Moonlit Warrior Selene!!=月光戦士セレーネのファン仲間がいて嬉しいよ！
I got here by clicking "random server".=「ランダムサーバー」をクリックしてここに来たの。
To be honest, I don't know very much about it.=実は、あまり知らないの。
I have no clue what that is, but it sounds lame.=それさっぱり分からないんけど、ダサそう。
...oh. So, uh, you don't actually know anything about MWS, then?=...そっか。ってことは、月セレについては何も分からない、よね？
That's fine! I love introducing people to MWS!=大丈夫！月セレを紹介するのは大好きだ！
It's not lame!! It's the best game ever!!=ダサくない！最高のゲームだ！
I'm actually really surprised that the game doesn't have a bigger following. It was so revolutionary for its time!=実はこのゲームがあんまりウケてないのに本当驚いているんだ。当時としては画期的だったんだ！
It had a badass female protagonist, a rich story with deep philosophical themes, and riveting cinematic cutscenes.=超かっこいい女主人公、ディープな哲学的テーマの充実したストーリー、そして映画みたいな魅力的なカットシーン。
Super ambitious for a game released in 1989, right?!=1989年発売のゲームとしては超意欲作だよな？！
I don't care about any of this.=こんなのどうでもいい。
Sounds cool. How can I play it?=良さそう。どうやってプレイするの？
That doesn't sound like a game from 1989 at all. You sure you got your facts straight?=1989年のゲームじゃないみたい。それって本当に正しいの？
Awwwww, come onnnnn, how can you not think it's the coolest thing ever?! I think I should tell you what makes it so great...=はあああああ、おいいいいい、最高にかっこいいだろ？！なんでこれが素晴らしいか話さないと...
Unless you have a Marufuku Entertainment System, you'll have to emulate it. It's super-easy to find the ROM, though!=マルフクコンピュータを持ってないなら、エミュレーターを使う必要がある。ROMを探すのは超簡単なんだけどね！
Of course my facts are correct! I'm the world's foremost authority on MWS! Well, at least, I like to call myself that, haha.=もちろん正しいさ！私はセレーネの世界的権威だから！まあ、少なくとも、自分ではそう呼んでる、あはは。
The gameplay was super-addictive, but what really got me hooked was the story. The protagonist is super "gray" - it's hard to decide if she's a good guy or a villain.=ゲーム性も超良いんだけど、本当にハマったのはストーリーだ。主人公が超「グレー」で、善人か悪人か決めづらい。
She's a serial killer, but she's only killing criminals - so, does that make her a good guy? Or, is she no different from the people she kills?=彼女は連続殺人犯だけど、殺すのは犯罪者だけ。なら、彼女は善人なのか？それとも、殺した相手と何も変わらないのか？
It gets you to think about questions like, "When is it justified to take a human life?" and, "When is it acceptable to take the law into your own hands?"=「どんな時に人の命を奪うのが正当化されるか」、「どんな時に法律を自らの手で行使するのが許されるか」みたいな問いについて考えさせられるんだ。
The game did an excellent job of exploring such complex subjects, in-between the gameplay sections. Cool, right?!=このゲームは、ゲーム内でこんなに複雑なテーマを探求していったんだ。すごいでしょ？！
I really, really don't care.=全然、興味ない。
Very interesting. I might give it a try sometime.=とても面白いわね。今度やってみようかな。
Sounds super pretentious.=壮大過ぎない？
How can you not?! It was revolutionary!!=どうして？！革命的だろ！！
Awesome!!=いいね！！
No, it's not pretentious at all! There are scenes where the protagonist doubts herself, but it doesn't rub philosophical questions in your face all the time.=いや、ずっと壮大なわけじゃないよ！主人公が自分を疑う場面はあるけど、哲学的な問いをずっと突きつけてくるわけじゃない。
Actually, some people have speculated that the developer's intention was to spread his personal belief that vigilantism is the only way to solve society's problems.=実は、開発者の意図は自警主義こそが社会問題を解決する唯一の方法だという開発者個人の信念を広めることだって考察する人もいるんだ。
He may have been attempting to convince players that they should imitate the game's protagonist and become serial-killing vigilantes in the real world.=主人公のように、現実世界でも連続殺人鬼を自らの手で裁くべきだと、プレイヤーにそう訴えているって説もある。
I don't know if those theories are true, but I have to admit, the game did have some solid arguments in advocacy of vigilantism.=その説が本当かは分からないけど、このゲームで自警主義が擁護されているのは事実だ。
What do you think? Are there situations where it's justified to take the law into your own hands?=君はどう思う？自らの手で法を執行すべき状況もあると思うかい？
I've never thought about it.=考えたことも無かったわ。
I guess there might be some situations like that.=そうすべき場合もあるわね。
No. Leave crime-fighting to the police.=警察に任せるべきよ。
It's a fun topic to discuss! It can lead to some really interesting debates!=とても興味深い論題でしょ？いろんな議論に発展しうるんだ！
I think so, too!=私もそう思うよ！
I wish we could trust them to keep us safe, but...=警察が信用できるなら良かったんだけど...
Sometimes, the police are corrupt. I've seen it firsthand. Too often, the legal system lets us down, and fails to deliver justice.=警察が腐敗する場合もあるんだ。私はそれを目の当たりにしてきた。法制度が機能せず、正義が執行されない場合があまりに多い。
I'm honestly surprised that I rarely hear people discussing this subject. Shouldn't this be at the forefront of everyone's minds? It's a matter of life and death.=正直、こういう議論が少ないのは驚きだよ。みんな真っ先に考えるべきなんだ。私らの生死を分ける重要なことなのに。
There are people in this world who have no problem with harming other people. I feel like they should be our top concern.=世の中には他人を平気で傷つける人もいる。そのことを忘れちゃダメだ。
If you take a single step outside of your home, you're putting yourself at risk of being victimized by a criminal. Actually, you can even be victimized INSIDE of your home!=家から一歩でも出ればいつ犯罪に遭うか分からない。家の中でだってそうだ。
Do you seriously believe the world is covered in violent criminals?=世の中が犯罪まみれだと本気で思ってるの？
If you're so concerned about crime, become a cop.=そんなに犯罪が憎いなら、警察になれば？
You sound paranoid and delusional.=妄想をこじらせすぎ。
Well, the *majority* of people aren't criminals...but there are still *enough* criminals to make this world a dangerous place.=まあ、世の中の大多数は犯罪者ではないけど...犯罪が多く危険な地域は世界にはごまんとあるよ。
Didn't you hear I just said about the police and the legal system? I'll spell it out for you: I don't have any faith in them.=警察や法制度についてはもう話しただろ？もう一度言うけど、私はそういうのを信用してないんだ。
If that's what you think, you must have the fortune of living in a much better city than I do.=もしそう思っているのなら、幸運にも君の住んでるところはいい町なんだろうね。
I don't like to share my personal details with random strangers I've only known for a few minutes, but I'll tell you a few things that might help you understand my point of view...=ついさっき知り合ったばかりの人に個人情報を教えたくはないけど、私の考えを理解してもらうために、少しだけ話させて...
In the country I live in, 33% of adults have a criminal record. The city I live in has the highest murder rate in the country. The police around here are notoriously corrupt, too.=私の住んでいる国では、成人の33%が前科持ちさ。私が住んでいる町は、その中でも一番犯罪率が高い。このあたりの警察は腐敗しきってて有名さ。
If I could afford it, I'd move to another city in a heartbeat. But, it's just not possible for me right now.=できることならすぐにでも引っ越したい。でも今は無理なんだ。
I'm not asking for pity, I'm just trying to explain why I'm=同情してほしいわけじゃない。ただ理由をせつめ
Oh, wait a sec...=あ、ちょっと待って...
Damn it...my mom is calling for me.=くそ...ママが呼んでる。
I have to go. I'll be back tomorrow! Bye!=行かなくちゃ。また明日！じゃあね！
Selene2005 has logged out.=Selene2005はログアウトしました
Ayano Aishi has logged in.=Ayano Aishiがログインしました
Yay, I was hoping you'd come back! Hi again!=やあ！また来てくれて嬉しいよ！
Nobody else has found this server yet...I tried promoting it on a few message boards, but my posts were flagged as spam, so nobody got to see. :(=このサーバー誰も見つけてくれなくてさ...掲示板で宣伝してみたんだけど、スパム扱いされて誰にも見てもらえなかったよ(´・ω・｀)
Hey, this is kinda off-topic, but have you ever heard of Life Note?=ちょっと話がそれるけど、ライフノートって知ってる？
I have the box set, but I haven't watched the whole thing.=ボックスセットは持ってるけど、全部は見てないわ
I read it back when it was a manga.=漫画は読んだ
Yeah, it's trash.=読んだことあるけどゴミだったわ
OMG WHY?? You absolutely need to see every episode!!=なんで？？絶対全部見るべきだよ！
LOL, you sound like such a hipster.=流行には敏感みたいだねw
Oh. My. God. I don't know how you could possibly say that. It's a masterpiece!=嘘でしょ！？マジで言ってるの！？あれは最高傑作だよ！
I'm in love with the premise. A supernatural notebook that can control a human's behavior, but only for 60 minutes...=設定が魅力的だよね。人間の行動を60分間だけ操れる魔法のノート...
What would you do, if you had a notebook like that?=そんなノートが本当にあったら、君はどうする？
It's fictional. It's not real.=現実じゃ有り得ないフィクションでしょ
I'd use it to keep the person I love safe.=愛する人を護るために使うわ
I wouldn't touch it.=ノートを使えないと思う
Duh, I know that! I'm asking hypothetically!=そんなのは分かってるよ！仮定の話をしてるんだ！
Awwwww, that's sweeeeet <3=へえ、素敵だね！(*^^*)
Seriously? How could you resist that kind of godlike power?=マジで？神みたいな力を手にできるのに？
If I could control people, I'd want to forbid everyone on Earth from committing crimes or harming others, and make the world into a utopia...=もし私が人を操れたら、地球上のすべての人に犯罪や他者を傷つける行為を禁止して、ユートピアを作り上げたいね...
...but, the Life Note can only control a person for 60 minutes...so, you can't use it to stop a person from committing crimes for the rest of their life...=でも、ライフノートは60分しか人を操れないし、みんなが一生犯罪しないようにはできない...
The Life Note can still create a utopia, though...by forcing criminals to end their own lives. That's what I'd do if I had a Life Note!=だけど犯罪者に自殺させることでユートピアは作れるんだ。私がライフノートを持ってたらそうするよ！
Then you'd have to die, too.=それなら、あなたも死ぬべき人ね
Would that really make the world a utopia?=それで世界がユートピアになるとでも？
You'd actually force people to end their lives if you had the opportunity?=可能なら他人に自殺を強要するってこと？
Huh? But, I'm not a criminal! Or, are you implying that I'd be a murderer if I used the Life Note to end lives? It's not "murder" if you're simply making the world a safer place!=え？でも私は犯罪者じゃないよ！？ライフノートで誰かを自殺させたって殺人罪にはならないよ。それに、世界をより安全にするためだ！
Well...I guess we'd still have disease and stuff, but we'd no longer have to fear other humans, and that's a pretty big deal.=まあ、病気とかを治すことはできないけど、もう他人におびえなくて済むのは凄いことでしょ？
It's not like I would be indiscriminately slaughtering innocent people! I would only target people who deserve to die!=無差別に罪のない人々を殺すわけじゃないんだ。死ぬべき悪人だけを殺すんだ！
Uh...now I'm kinda worried about what you think of me...I don't want you to think I'm some sort of psychopath...=えっと、今君は私のことどう思ってるんだろ...サイコパス扱いされたらへこむなあ...
Okay, I know it must seem like I'm obsessed with this topic, but...just hear me out.=この話題に執着してるように見えるかもしれないけど、ちょっと聞いて欲しい
First, let's establish something. Would you rather live in a world *with* criminals, or *without* criminals?=まず最初に、犯罪がある世界と犯罪がない世界、どっちがいい？
I don't have any interest in arguing with you.=あなたと議論する気はないんだけど。
I'd rather live in a world without criminals.=犯罪者がいない世界かな。
You want to use my answer to justify mass-murder.=大量殺人を正当化するのに私の答えを使いたいだけでしょ？
No, no! This isn't an argument! I'm just explaining my stance, that's all!=違うよ！これは議論じゃなくて、私のスタンスを説明してるんだ！
Okay! We're on the same page so far!=OK！ここまでは同じ考えだね！
That's not it! I just need you to explain something to me!=そうじゃなくて！説明させてくれ！
Obviously, nobody wants to live in a world where they might be mugged or murdered. Everyone agrees that a world without criminals would be preferable to a world *with* criminals.=もちろん、誰も強盗や殺人におびえながら暮らしたいとは思わない。犯罪者がいない世界の方が、犯罪者がいるより良いものだってのは、みんなが思ってる
But, if that's the case...=それなのに...
Why do people always react negatively when I say that all criminals in the world should die?=私が「犯罪者はみんな死んでしまえ」って言うと、みんな否定的な反応をするのはなぜだろう？
Regardless of whether or not you're correct, advocating for mass-murder will always sound edgy.=正しいかは別として、大量殺人を擁護しちゃうのはちょっとね...
It's a statement that lacks compassion or empathy.=思いやりがなく共感できない発言だからじゃない？
It would be preferable to rehabilitate criminals, rather than kill them.=犯罪者を殺すより、更生させる方が望ましいからじゃない？
What a shame. People shouldn't be so quick to dismiss execution as a valid solution to many of society's problems.=残念だね。死刑は社会問題の解決にとっても役立つんだ。そう簡単に否定すべきじゃないよ
But *criminals* lack compassion and empathy, and that's why we need them gone!=でも、犯罪者にも思いやりはないし共感できないだろ？だからこそ、犯罪者は排除すべきなんだ！
I wish it was possible, but I don't think that's the case.=それが可能ならいいけど、そうもいかないもんだよ
The most common counter-argument I've heard is, "Just send criminals to prison so they can be reformed." But, I don't think it's that simple.=よく「犯罪者は刑務所に入れればいい。それで更生する」って話を聞くけど、そんな単純な話じゃないと思うんだ
I've looked up the statistics for the country I live in. Two-thirds of criminals go straight back to committing crimes after they get out of prison. Prison doesn't solve anything.=私の住んでる国の統計では、犯罪者の2/3は刑務所から出た後再犯するんだ。刑務所は何の解決にもならないよ
The only way to fix this world is to eliminate dangerous people as soon as they've demonstrated their true nature.=危険な人間が本性を現したらすぐ排除する。これがこの世界を救う唯一の方法さ
That's why I=だから私ｈ
Oh crap, my mom needs to use the computer...=やばい、ママがパソコン使いたいって...
Ugh...I don't want you to think that this is the only subject I talk about...=こんな話題しか話せないと思われるとヤダなあ...
I'll make you a promise. Our next conversation won't have anything to do with criminals or capital punishment. Okay?=約束するよ。次の話題は犯罪者や死刑と関係ないものにする。いい？
I gotta go. Bye!=もう行かなきゃ。バイバイ！
Hey, you're back! I'm glad I didn't scare you off, lol.=また来てくれたんだ！怖がらせちゃったかなって心配だったよ！
Don't worry, I'm going to keep my promise...I won't discuss the usual stuff.=大丈夫、約束は守るよ...普通の話題にはしないけど
For an MWS server, we haven't discussed MWS very much, have we? lol=月セレのサーバーなのに全然月セレの話してなかったよねw
But, if you haven't played it, then there's not much to discuss...=でも、プレイしてないんでしょ？あまり話すこともなさそうだしなあ...
Ooh, I know what to talk about!=あ、そうだ！
Have you ever heard of the "Ship of Theseus"?=「テセウスの船」って知ってるかい？
I don't care about some boat.=船なんかどうでもいいよ
I may have heard about it at some point.=聞いたことあるかも
Never heard of it.=聞いたことない
No, it's not an actual boat! It's a hypothetical boat!=いや、本物の船の話じゃなくて、仮説の話さ！
Just to make sure we're thinking of the same thing, I'll summarize it.=じゃあ念のため軽くおさらいするね
Cool, I get to be the one to tell you about it!=大丈夫！私が教えてあげるよ！
The "Ship of Theseus" is a thought experiment.=「テセウスの船」は思考実験の一つさ。
Imagine a ship that is sailing across the ocean. During the journey, parts of the ship fall off, and are replaced with spare parts. Eventually, 100% of the ship's parts are replaced.=大海原を航海してる船があって、途中で船の部品が落ち、予備と交換される。やがて、船の部品は全部予備のものになってしまった
When the ship finally reaches its destination...can it still be considered the *same ship* that started the journey, or should it now be considered a *different ship*?=果たして、目的地に着いたその船は、出発するときの船と同じものと言えるだろうか、それとも別の船だろうか？
Who cares?=だから何？
It's still the same ship.=同じ船だと思う
It's a different ship.=別の船だと思う
OMG, come on!! The "ship" represents something more important, don't you get it?=「船」はもっと重要なものを象徴してるんだ！なんでわからないかなぁ...
Interesting! That's the same conclusion that I reached, but only after considering it for a really long time.=いいね！私も長い事考えたけど、同じ結論になったよ！
Ohhhhh? Are you sure? I wonder if I can change your answer...=えー？そうなの？君の考えを変えることはできるかな...
If someone argues that it's a different ship, the question becomes...*when* did it become a different ship?=もし別の船だとするなら、一体いつ別の船になったのかが問題になるんだ
Was it when the first part was replaced? Or, when more than 50% of parts were replaced? Was it when the final part was replaced? Or, when a specific part of the ship was replaced?=最初の部品が交換されたとき？半分以上交換されたとき？全部の部品が交換されたとき？それとも、ある特定の部品が交換されたとき？
The Ship of Theseus sparks all kinds of interesting questions!=「テセウスの船」はいろんな興味深い問いを投げかけてくれるんだ
This is boring as hell.=つまんないね
I'm guessing that the ship is a metaphor for something.=船は何かの例えなのね
Is there any practical purpose to this question?=この問いに実用的な意味はあるの？
Oh, yeah? Let's see if THIS changes your mind...=そうかなあ？じゃあこの質問で考えが変わるか見てみよう...
You got it!=そうなんだよ！
Yes, there is! The ship can be a metaphor for a wide variety of things!=もちろん！船はものの例えに過ぎないんだ！
Let's replace "ship traveling across ocean" with "human traveling through life".=「海を渡る船」を「人生を旅する人」に置き換えてみなよ
Your body contains over 50 million cells. Each of those cells has a lifespan - some of them die after 8 hours, but others live for up to 7 years.=人間の体には5000万個以上の細胞があって、その細胞にはそれぞれ寿命があって、8時間で死ぬ細胞もあれば、7年も生きる細胞もある
This means that, after 7 years have passed, every single cell in your body has died and been replaced with a new cell.=つまり、7年もたてば、君の体の細胞は一つ残らず死んで、新しい細胞に入れ替わるんだ
If every cell in your body has been replaced, can you still consider yourself the "same person"?=もし君の細胞が全て入れ替わったとして、君はまだ「同じ人間」であると言えるのかな？
I'm not interested in this pseudo-philosophical garbage.=そんな哲学じみた無駄話に興味ないんだけど
I guess I would technically no longer be the "same person" if all of my cells were replaced.=細胞が全部入れ替わったら、技術的にはもう「同じ人間」とは言えないんじゃない？
I am not my cells. I am not affected by my cells being replaced.=私は細胞なんかじゃない。細胞が入れ替わっても、私は私よ。
Seriously?! It's a valid question! It concerns your very existence!=マジで？これは大事な質問だよ！君の実存に関わることさ！
That's a kind of scary thought...it means that, within 7 years, "you" won't be alive anymore.=ということは、7年で「君」は消えてしまうってことだね
So, you define yourself as the consciousness inside of your brain, or a "soul", or something like that, right?=つまり、自分というものは脳の中の意識とか、魂とか、そういうものと定義しているってことかい？
Let me re-frame the question. As the years pass, your experiences gradually shape you into a different person.=質問をし直すよ。年月が経つにつれて、君は徐々に別人へと変わっていくはずだ。
What kind of person were you, 7 years ago? What type of person will you be in 7 years? Will you have the same values? The same beliefs? The same personality?=7年前の君はどんな人？7年後は？同じ価値観を持ってる？同じ信念を持ってる？同じ性格？
If you change so drastically that you have *nothing* in common with your old self, should you considered the "same person" or a "new person"?=もし、昔の自分と共通点がないほど大きく変わってしまったら、「新しい人間」と考えるべきなのか、それでも「同じ人間」と考えるべきなのか？
I don't know why you care so much about this.=そんなことどうでもよくない？
I guess it's possible that I could change enough to be considered a different person altogether.=全くの別人だと思われるほど変わる可能性もあると思う
No matter how much I change, I'll always be "me".=どんなに変わっても、私は私よ
Heh, well, about that...=あ、そう...
That's the conclusion that I reached, too!=私もそう思ってる
I wonder why? What intrinsic trait makes you "you", even when everything about you has changed?=なんでだい？自分のすべてが変わっても、まだ「自分」だって言える本質的なものって何だろう？
I really want to explain why the Ship of Theseus is such a big deal to me, but... =本当は「テセウスの船」がどれだけ大きな意味を持つのか教えたかったんだけど...
...well, it has to do with those subjects I promised I wouldn't talk about today.=...今日話題にしないと約束したことに関係があるんだ
So, let's pause the conversation here, and pick it back up tomorrow, okay?=そろそろ話を中断して、明日また話そう
Hope to see you tomorrow!!=また明日！じゃあね！
Yay, I'm so glad you're back!!=やあ！また来てくれたんだね！嬉しいよ！
Okay, so, continuing from where we left off...=さて、前回の続きだけど...
The reason I brought up the Ship of Theseus is because it leads into something else I want to talk about:=「テセウスの船」を持ち出したのは、別の話をするためなんだ
Let's imagine that a man commits murder. However, nobody can find any incriminating evidence, so he doesn't get convicted of his crime...=ある男が殺人を犯したとしよう。でも、誰も決定的な証拠を見つけられず、罪には問われなかった...
Can we imagine that it's a Japanese schoolgirl instead of a man?=男じゃなくて、日本の女子学生を想定してもいい？
I'd like to know what method he used, and how he disposed of the evidence.=どうやって証拠を消したのか、気になるわね
That's impressive.=印象的ね
Huh? I...the murderer's identity isn't really important.=え？まあ...犯人の身元は重要じゃないし、いいけど...
Um, well...it doesn't really matter. =うーん...そこは別に重要じゃないんだけど...
I, uh...I mean, sure, I guess it's technically impressive, but it's still a crime, you know?=えっと...確かに技術は凄いけど、犯罪者であることに変わりはないからね？
Anyway! 7 years pass, and you discover evidence of the man's crime. You could get him arrested! But, at that point in time, the man has developed into a completely different person.=とにかく！7年後、あなたはその男の犯罪の証拠を見つけた。彼を逮捕できる。でも、その時点で男は全くの別人になっていた
The man now has different values, different beliefs, a different personality, etc. You wouldn't even be able to recognize him as the same guy who committed murder 7 years ago.=価値観も、信念も、性格も変わっていた。7年前に殺人を犯した男とは同一人物と言えないくらいにね
He's also attempted to atone for his crime by doing good deeds for the past 7 years. Donating to charity, feeding the homeless, etc.=そして、彼はこの7年間、善行を積んで罪を償おうとしていた。慈善事業への寄付、ホームレスへの食事提供などでね
Considering how much the man has changed since he committed murder, would you report his crime, or would you let him remain free?=殺人を犯してからの彼の変化を考慮したうえで、君は彼の犯罪を通報する？それとも彼を自由の身にする？
I wouldn't do anything. It's not my concern.=何もしないわ。私には関係ないもの
I'd turn him in. He still needs to pay for his crime.=警察に突き出すわね。彼にはきちんと罰を受ける義務がある
I'd stay silent. It doesn't sound like he deserves to be punished.=罰に値するとは思えないし、黙っておく
So...you don't care if people are murdered, unless it affects you? You don't care about justice being delivered, unless you're personally involved?=じゃあ...人が殺されても気にしないの？自分に影響がない限り？個人的に関与してない限り、正義が遂行されることにも関心がないの？
Ooh, ice cold. No mercy for the guy who did everything possible to atone for his sins?=冷たいね。罪を償うためにできる限りのことをした男に、慈悲はないの？
So, you'd appoint yourself as his "judge", and decide his verdict yourself, completely bypassing the police and legal system? That's similar to what vigilantes do...just sayin'...=つまり、君は「裁判官」になったつもりで、警察や法制度を完全に無視して自分で判決を出すわけだ。彼は無罪だってね。まるで自警団だ...
Okay, let's imagine a different scenario:=じゃあ、別のシナリオを想像してみようか
A man commits murder...then, immediately afterwards, he develops amnesia. He has absolutely no knowledge of his crime. He builds a new life and develops a completely new identity.=ある男が殺人を犯し、その直後に記憶喪失になった。彼は自分が犯した犯罪なんてこれっぽっちも知らない。彼は新しい人生を歩み、全く別の人格を形成する
Seven years later, you find evidence of the man's crime. He still doesn't remember a single thing about his former identity. From his perspective, someone *else* committed that murder.=7年後、君はその男の犯罪の証拠を見つける。彼はまだ、以前の自分を思い出せていない。彼にとっては、身に覚えのない殺人だ
Considering the fact that he has amnesia and doesn't remember anything from his previous life, would you report his crime, or would you let him remain free?=彼が記憶喪失になる前のことを全く覚えてないことを考慮して、君は彼の犯罪を通報する？それともしない？
I have no desire to get involved in this man's life.=その人の人生に関わる気はないわ
I'd turn him in. He still needs to pay for his crime.=警察に突き出すわね。まだ彼には罪を償う義務がある
I'd stay silent. He's not the same person as the murderer.=殺人犯と彼はもう別人だし、黙っておくわね
Come onnnnn, that completely ruins the entire point of having a fun thought experiment!=おいおい、それじゃせっかくの興味深い思考実験が台無しだよ！
Really?! Even though he's developed into a completely different person?! Geez...harsh.=本当かい？もう別人になっちゃったのに！？厳しいねえ...
Ooh...reminds me of our conversation about the Ship of Theseus.=ふむ...「テセウスの船」を思い出すよね
Okay, next question. No murders this time.=じゃあ、次の質問だ。今回は殺人と関係ないよ
Let's say that there are two thieves. One of them steals because of greed. The other one steals because he's trying to feed his starving family.=二人の泥棒がいた。一人は欲に駆られて盗み、もう一人は飢えた家族を養うために盗みをしていた
Both thieves are caught, and you have to judge them. Would you punish the two thieves equally, would you give them both different punishments?=二人とも捕まり、君は彼らを裁かねばならない。二人の泥棒を同じように罰する？それとも違う罰にする？
I'm not a judge.=私は裁判官じゃないんだけど
I'd punish the two thieves equally.=平等に罰する
I wouldn't be able to punish them equally.=平等には罰せない
It's a hypothetical question, silly!!!=過程の話だよ！馬鹿！！
Really? Even though the two of them have completely different circumstances?=へえ？二人の境遇は全く違うのに？
Oh, yeah? The police and legal system might not see it that way...=へえ？警察や法制度はそう考えられたりしないと思うけど...
I guess the reason why I'm considering this stuff is because I keep thinking, "What if I had the same powers as Selene?" and "What if I had a Life Note"?=なんでこんなことを考えるのかというと、もし自分がセレーネと同じ力を持っていたら、もし自分がライフノートを手にしたら、とずっと考えているからなんだ
My gut reaction is to say, "I would make the world a utopia by killing all criminals!" But, it's not really that simple, you know?=直感的には、「犯罪者は皆殺しだ！ユートピアを作るんだ！」と思っちゃうけど、そんな単純な話じゃないよね
There is always the possibility - however slim - that even a violent criminal could eventually redeem himself...=たとえ凶悪な犯罪者でも、いずれは更生する可能性がある...たとえほんの僅かであってもね
...and not every person who has broken a law deserves to die, because some crimes are harmless...=それに、法律を破った人はみんな死んでいいってわけでもない。無害な犯罪だってある...
...and besides that, many of the people who make this world a horrible place aren't actually criminals. There are many ways to harm others; most of them aren't even crimes.=それに、この世界を地獄にしてる人間の多くは、実は犯罪者じゃないんだ。他人を傷つける方法はたくさんある。そのほとんどは犯罪ですらない
I wish there was a way to sort the entire human race into two categories: people who make the world a better place, and people who make the world worse for others.=全人類を、世界を良くする人と、世界を悪くする人の2つに分類する方法があったらなぁ
That would make it so much easier to decide who should live and who should die...=そうすれば、誰が生きるべきか、誰が死ぬべきかを決めるのがとても簡単になるのに...
You say that like you're planning to go out and kill a bunch of people.=まるで大量殺人を計画してるみたいな言い方ね
You don't have super powers, and you don't have a Life Note. Why consider any of this?=あなたには超能力もライフノートもない。そんなこと考えてどうするの？
You should spend your time thinking about more productive things, instead.=もっと生産的なことに時間を使ったら？
Well, I...=まあ、私は...
You don't *need* super powers or a Life Note in order to make an impact...=超能力やライフノートがなくたって、世界を変えることはできるよ...
What's more productive than making the world a better, safer place?!=世界をより良く、より安全にすることより生産的なことがあるか！？
I just...want to make a positive difference in the world.=私はただ...世界に希望をもたらしたいだけなんだ
No, that's not it...it's more than that.=いや、違うな...それ以上だ...
I want to *change* this world.=私はこの世界を変えたいんだ
I...=私は...
Ugh...I can't really figure out how to explain this...=どう説明すればいいかな...
Let's continue this conversation tomorrow, after I've had some time to think it over.=この話の続きはまた明日にしよう。少し考える時間をくれ
Hey. I was really hoping you were going to get online. There's something I want to talk with you about.=やあ！君がオンラインになるのをずっと待ってたんだ。話したいことがあってね
I feel like these conversations we've been having have really helped me. I think I've reached the conclusion that I've been searching for.=君との会話で、本当に私は救われたよ。探し求めていた結論に、ついに手が届いたんだ
Seriously? I haven't said anything meaningful.=本当？何か意味のあること話したっけ？
Glad I could help.=お役に立てて嬉しいわ
For some reason, hearing those words makes me really nervous.=そんなこと言われると、すごく不安になるんだけど
It's not anything you said. It's the fact that I walked through all of my thoughts one-by-one with another person. That's how you helped.=君が言ったことじゃない。自分の考えを一つ一つ他の人に話せたという事実が大事なんだ。それで私は助かったんだ
Okay, so, I'll explain...=じゃあ、説明するよ...
Hey! Just hear me out!=酷いな！ちょっと聞いてくれよ！
I've realized that society's problems don't come from "crime" or "criminals". It's something else.=社会問題の原因は、「犯罪」でも「犯罪者」でもないと気付いたんだ。別のものだ
It's "Evil".=それは「悪」だ
This world is a horrible place because of "Evil".=「悪」がこの世界を荒らしてるんだ
...that's it? That's your big revelation?=...それだけ？それがあなたの大発見なの？
I don't understand what you're trying to say.=何が言いたいの？
"Evil" is an extremely broad concept. The definition changes from person to person.=「悪」はとても広い概念だし、人によって定義が変わるけど
I was worried that you wouldn't take it seriously...=真面目に考えてくれないんじゃないかと思ってたよ...
I'll try to explain.=説明するよ
I'm talking about a very specific definition of "Evil".=私が言ってるのは、非常に具体的な「悪」の定義についてだよ
A person is "Evil" if they have no regard for the well-being of others, and regularly harm others for their own benefit. This type of person is, objectively, making the world worse.=他人の幸福を顧みず、自分の利益のために他人に危害を加える人は「悪」だ。こういう奴らが、客観的に世の中を悪くしてる
I believe that all of the problems in society can be traced to evil people. =私は、こういう悪人が社会を悪くしてるんだと思う
This world is full of cruelty, but if all evil people were exterminated, we would be living in a utopia.=この世界は残酷なものばかりだ。だけど、もしすべての悪人がいなくなれば、この世界はユートピアになる
I'm getting pretty tired of this topic. Can't you talk about anything else?=もうこの話題飽きちゃった。別の話題はないの？
What you're saying is true, but you're describing a fantasy scenario. There will always be evil.=言ってることは正しいけど、明確な悪人なんてものがいるのはファンタジーの中だけよ
You really love to talk about exterminating people.=あなたは本当に人類を絶滅させる話が好きね
I'm sorry. I can't stop thinking about this subject. It's more concerning to me than anything else. I hate living in fear, and I want a solution. Can you blame me for that?=すまない。でもこの話が頭から離れない。おびえて生きるのはもう嫌だ。解放されたい。そんな私を責めることができるかい？
It wouldn't be an easy goal to accomplish...but that doesn't mean I shouldn't try.=簡単に達成できる目標じゃないけど...それでも挑戦しないわけにはいかない
I wouldn't have to do that if we lived in a safe world, but the world we live in is confronting us with a problem that we have to solve.=安全な場所に住んでればそんなことしなくてもいいんだろうけど、私たちが住んでいる世界は、解決すべき問題が山積みだよ
I just want the world to be a better place. I just want a world without cruel people in it. I just want to be able to live without fear.=私はただ、世界をより良い場所にしたいんだ。残酷な人々の居ない世界にしたいんだ。恐怖の無い世界にしたいだけなんだ
No matter how much I think about it, no matter what angle I look at it from, no matter how hard I try to deny it, I always arrive at the same conclusion:=どんなに考えても、どんな見方をしても、どんなに否定しようとしても、結局同じ結論になるんだ
The only way to save this world is with a genocide.=この世界を救うには、ジェノサイドしかない
"Genocide" should only be a dirty word if you're targeting people for their race or religion. There's nothing wrong with wiping out evil.=「ジェノサイド」という言葉は、人種や宗教を理由に大量虐殺した場合に使われる言葉だけど、悪を一掃するのは悪いことじゃない
A genocide of evil people would make the world into a utopia, wouldn't it?=悪を一掃すれば世界はユートピアになるはずだ。そうだろ？
"Evil" according to who? You? Why should you, specifically, decide who lives and who dies?=誰が「悪」なの？あなた？何故あなたが他人の生き死にを決めるの？
I can't really disagree with what you're saying.=まあ、その通りね
You have a strong desire to spill blood, and you're trying to find a way to justify it.=あなたに殺人願望があって、それを正当化したいだけに見えるけど
Because nobody else is stepping up to fix the problems of this broken world.=誰もこの間違った世界を変えようとしないからだよ
I'm glad you see it my way!!=同志がいて嬉しいよ！
That couldn't be further from the truth! I just want to live in a world without people who harm others! I'd do it without bloodshed, if only I thought it was possible!=違うんだ！私はただ他人を傷つける人の居ない世界に住みたいだけなんだ！誰も死なずにそれが実現できるなら、私だってそうしたいよ！
At this point, we've had numerous conversations with each other. I think you've gotten to know me well enough to judge me. Go ahead, don't hold back, tell me the truth...=もうお互いに何度も会話してるし、私のことを結構分かってきただろ？遠慮しないで、本当のことを話してほしい...
What do you think of me?=私のこと、どう思ってる？
You have good intentions, but I'm worried that you might actually hurt someone and go to prison. Stop obsessing over vigilantes from video games and manga. Grow up.=悪い人ではないと思っているけど、実際に人を傷つけて刑務所行きにならないか心配。ゲームや漫画の見過ぎで自警主義にこだわるのはやめなさい。大人になりなさいよ
You might be humanity's only hope. You might be the only person who is willing to do what must be done in order to fix this broken world.=人類の唯一の希望ね。この世界の歪みを正そうとする気があるのは、あなただけかもしれない
You're a sick, deranged person. You need help, you psychopath.=病的に狂ってるわね。治療が必要じゃない？サイコパスにも程があるわよ
I...=私は...
Really? You think so? That's...that's all I ever wanted. I just want to fix this world. I just want a pure, clean world...=本当に？そう思う？それは...私が今まで望んできたことだ。私はこの世界を正したいだけだ。私はただ、純粋できれいな世界に憧れてる...
...owch. I know I asked you to be honest, but...damn.=うーん...覚悟はしてたけどやっぱ、実際に言われると良い気はしないな...
I'm going to log off for a while. I need to figure some stuff out. I'll keep your words in mind. I don't know when will be the next time I log on.=しばらくログオフするよ。ちょっと考えたいことがあってね。君の言葉は心に留めておく。次にログオンするのはいつになるかわからない
I'll see you around. Or maybe not. I honestly don't know.=また会えるかな？会えないかな？正直、私にもよくわからないよ

Osana殺害の計画
You can use this screen to plan the way that you will eliminate your rival.\r\n\nIf you select an elimination method on this screen, you will unlock instructions for that elimination method.\r\n\nThe instructions can be accessed from the "Schemes" menu accessed from the Pause Screen.\r\n\nChoose "Freestyle" if you'd like to play without guidance.=恋敵を排除する計画を選びましょう。\r\n\nここでいずれかの排除計画を選んだ場合、その排除計画を見られるようになります。\r\n\n計画の内容はポーズ画面の「ガイド」メニューで見ることができます。\r\n\nガイドが不要なら「フリースタイル」を選んでください。
Selecting an elimination method on this screen will not permanently lock you into using that method.=この画面で排除方法を選択しても、別の方法で恋敵を排除することは可能です
How would you like to eliminate your rival?=どの方法で恋敵を排除する？
Difficulty:=難易度:
Freestyle=フリースタイル
No plan! \n\n Just jump right in! \n\n You'll figure something out... \n\n ...probably.=計画なんて不要！\n\n時間のムダだ！\n\n自分で排除方法を考えることになるだろう...\n\n...たぶん。
You could eliminate Osana by attacking her with a lethal weapon. \n\n However, Osana's best friend - Raibaru - will try to stop you. \n\n Info-chan can sell you advice for eliminating Raibaru. \n\n You can contact Info-chan using the Pause Menu while at school.=Osanaを武器で殺害して排除。\n\nしかしOsanaの親友のRaibaruの邪魔が入りそうだ。\n\nインフォちゃんがRaibaruを消す方法を売ってくれる。\n\nインフォちゃんには校内でポーズメニューを開くことで連絡できる。
You could eliminate Osana by lethally attacking her with a weapon.\r\n`\r\nHowever, Osana's best friend - Raibaru - will try to stop you.\r\n`\r\nInfo-chan can sell you information that will make it easy to eliminate Raibaru.\r\n`\r\nYou can contact Info-chan using the Pause Menu while at school.=Osanaを武器で殺害して排除。\n\nしかしOsanaの親友のRaibaruの邪魔が入りそうだ。\n\nインフォちゃんがRaibaruを消す方法を売ってくれる。\n\nインフォちゃんには校内でポーズメニューを開くことで連絡できる。
You could eliminate Osana by befriending her. \n\n If you do a massive favor for her, you could put her in debt to you. \n\n Then, she would have to listen to you when you tell her... \n\n ...to stay away from your Senpai.=Osanaと親友になって排除。\n\nもしOsanaに大きな貸しを作れば、こちらの頼みを聞かざるを得なくなる。\n\nそして、Osanaにこう言うのだ...\n\n「センパイと関わらないで」と。
You could eliminate Osana after tricking her into trusting you. \n\n If you do a massive favor for her, you could put her in debt to you. \n\n After that, you could lull her into a false sense of security... \n\n ...and eliminate her when she is vulnerable.=Osanaの信頼を得たうえで罠にはめて排除する。\n\nOsanaに大きな貸しを作って恩を着せる。\n\nその上でOsanaの警戒を解いて安心させて... \n\n...隙をついて排除。
You could eliminate Osana by bullying her until she leaves school. \n\n You would have to damage her reputation by gossiping about her. \n\n If Osana's reputation drops lower than -100... \n\n ...she will withdraw from school and never return.=Osanaをいじめて学校を辞めさせて排除。\n\nOsanaの悪評を流して評判を落とせばいい。\n\n評判が-100以下になれば...\n\n...学校を辞めて戻っても来ないだろう。
You could eliminate Osana by bullying her until she leaves school. \n\n You would have to damager her reputation by gossiping about her. \n\n If Osana's reputation drops lower than -100... \n\n ...she will withdraw from school and never return.=Osanaをいじめて学校を辞めさせて排除。\n\nOsanaの悪評を流して評判を落とせばいい。\n\n評判が-100以下になれば...\n\n...学校を辞めて戻っても来ないだろう。
You could eliminate Osana by setting her on fire. \n\n This would require the use of gasoline and a candle. \n\n Osana's friend - Raibaru - will warn her if she smells gasoline. \n\n Contact Info-chan for advice on how to eliminate Raibaru.=Osanaに火を着けて燃やして排除。\n\nガソリンとロウソクが必要になる。\n\nOsanaの親友のRaibaruがガソリンの臭いを察知して邪魔してくるので注意。\n\nインフォちゃんに頼めばRaibaru排除のアドバイスをもらえる。
You could eliminate Osana by crushing her to death. \n\n You would need to drop something heavy on her from above. \n\n You can get her to stand right where you want her to stand... \n\n ...by leaving a note in her locker to arrange a meeting.=Osanaを押し潰して死なせて排除。\n\nOsana上から何か重いものを落とす。\n\nOsanaの下駄箱に待ち合わせの手紙を入れれば...\n\n...目ぼしい場所に立っててもらうように仕向けられる。
You could eliminate Osana by drowning her to death. \n\n You could put emetic poison into her lunch... \n\n ...which would cause her to run to the bathroom to vomit... \n\n ...where you could shove her head into the toilet and drown her.=Osanaを溺れ死にさせて排除。\n\n催吐毒をOsanaの弁当に盛る...\n\n...そうすればトイレまで来て吐きに来るはずだから...\n\n...頭を押し込んで溺れさせてやればいい。
You could eliminate Osana by electrocuting her to death. \n\n There are various ways to do this. The most straightforward way... \n\n ...would be to throw a car battery into a puddle of water... \n\n ...while Osana is standing in the puddle.=Osanaを感電死させて排除。\n\nいろんな方法がある。一番早いのは...\n\n...Osanaが水たまりに立ってるタイミングでカーバッテリーを放り込めばいい。
You could eliminate Osana by getting her expelled from school. \n\n Osana is a well-behaved student, so you would need to frame her. \n\n For example, you'd have to put alcohol into her bookbag... \n\n ...and report that to the guidance counselor, among other things.=Osanaを強制退学に追いやって排除。\n\nOsanaは素行のいい生徒だから陥れる必要がある。\n\n例えば、酒をOsanaの鞄に忍ばせて...\n\n...カウンセラーにチクるなどを繰り返す。
You could decapitate Osana using the blades of a powerful fan. \n\n You would need to arrange a meeting on the school rooftop... \n\n ...and, once Osana is standing close enough to a fan unit... \n\n ...you'd get her hair caught in the fan blades, ensuring death.=Osanaの頭を換気扇に押し込んで首をそぎ落として排除。\n\nOsanaと屋上で待ち合わせ...\n\n...Osanaが換気扇に近付いた隙に...\n\n...髪を換気扇に絡ませれば死んでくれる。
You could get Osana sent to jail by framing her for a murder. \n\n You would need to get Osana's fingerprints onto a weapon... \n\n ...and then you'd need to use that weapon to commit a murder. \n\n (Without getting your own fingerprints on the weapon, obviously.)=Osanaに殺人の冤罪をかぶせて牢獄送りにして排除。\n\n武器にOsanaの指紋をつけて...\n\n...その武器で誰かを殺せばいい。\n\n（当たり前だが、武器に自分の指紋がつかないように。）
You could kidnap Osana and hold her prisoner in your basement. \n\n You would have to tranquilize her and hide her inside of a case. \n\n Osana's friend Raibaru would try to stop that from happening... \n\n ...so first you'd have to eliminate Raibaru. Info-chan could help.=Osanaを誘拐、地下室に監禁して排除。\n\n鎮静剤で眠らせてケースに隠す。\n\nOsanaの友達のRaibaruが妨害してくるだろう...\n\n...まずはRaibaruを排除することになる。インフォちゃんの手を借りよう。
You could kidnap Osana and hold her prisoner in your basement. \n\n You would have to tranquilizer her and hide her inside of a case. \n\n Osana's friend Raibaru would try to stop that from happening... \n\n ...so first you'd have to eliminate Raibaru. Info-chan could help.=Osanaを誘拐、地下室に監禁して排除。\n\n鎮静剤で眠らせてケースに隠す。\n\nOsanaの友達のRaibaruが妨害してくるだろう...\n\n...まずはRaibaruを排除することになる。インフォちゃんの手を借りよう。
You could make Osana fall in love with another boy. \n\n Somewhere at school, there is a boy who has a crush on Osana. \n\n You would need to find that boy, make friends with him... \n\n ...and give him advice to turn him into Osana's ideal man.=Osanaを別の男子とくっつけて排除。\n\n校内にはOsanaが好きな男子がいるはずだ。\n\nその男子を見つけ、彼と友だちになり...\n\n...Osanaの理想の男子になるようアドバイスしてやろう。
You could force another student to murder Osana for you. \n\n You would need to kidnap a female student from school... \n\n ...torture her inside of your basement until her mind breaks... \n\n ...and send the mind-broken slave on a mission to murder Osana.=他の生徒にOsanaを殺害させて排除。\n\nまず女生徒を誘拐し...\n\n...地下で拷問して精神を破壊し...\n\n...ソレにOsanaを殺すよう命令する。
You could eliminate Osana by poisoning her to death. \n\n You would need to obtain some lethal poison at school... \n\n ...put the poison into Osana's bento, wait until she eats it. \n\n It would be relatively easy, but it might traumatize Senpai...=Osanaを毒殺して排除。\n\n校内で致死毒を入手し...\n\n...Osanaの弁当に入れ、それを食べるのを待つ。\n\n比較的簡単だが、センパイにトラウマを植え付けてしまうかも。
You could eliminate Osana by making her drown in the school pool. \n\n You would accomplish this by tying Osana's hair to a weight... \n\n ...and pushing that weight into the pool, taking Osana with it. \n\n This method would only work on a day when Osana is sunbathing.=Osanaをプールに沈めて排除。\n\nOsanaの髪に重石をくくりつけ...\n\n...Osanaを重石ごとプールに落とす。\n\nこの方法はOsanaが日光浴をする日しか使えない。
You could eliminate Osana by pushing her off the school rooftop. \n\n This could be accomplished by arranging a meeting on the roof... \n\n ...but Osana's friend Raibaru won't let you get away with murder. \n\n So, you'd have to eliminate Raibaru first. Info-chan could help.=Osanaを屋上から突き落として排除。\n\nOsanaと待ち合せの約束を屋上ですれば可能だが...\n\n...Osanaの友人のRaibaruの邪魔が入るだろう。\n\nそのため、まずRaibaruを排除する必要がある。インフォちゃんの助けを借りよう。
You could eliminate Osana by ruining her friendship with Senpai. \n\n Osana and Senpai have multiple interactions every day. \n\n You would have to sabotage these interactions on a daily basis... \n\n ...until Senpai hates Osana enough to reject her love confession.=Osanaとセンパイの仲を引き裂いて排除。\n\nOsanaはセンパイと毎日何度も交流している。\n\nこれを毎日妨害すれば...\n\nセンパイはOsanaが嫌いになり、告白も受け入れないだろう。
You could eliminate Osana by driving her to take her own life. \n\n You would have to damage her reputation by gossiping about her. \n\n If Osana's reputation drops lower than -150... \n\n ...she would choose death in order to escape the extreme bullying.=Osanaを自殺に追い込んで排除。\n\nOsanaの噂話を流して評判を下げていく。\n\nOsanaの評判が-150以下になれば...\n\n...Osanaはいじめを苦に死を選ぶだろう。
You could eliminate Osana by driving her to take her own life. \n\n You would have to damager her reputation by gossiping about her. \n\n If Osana's reputation drops lower than -150... \n\n ...she would choose death in order to escape the extreme bullying.=Osanaを自殺に追い込んで排除。\n\nOsanaの噂話を流して評判を下げていく。\n\nOsanaの評判が-150以下になれば...\n\n...Osanaはいじめを苦に死を選ぶだろう。
You could convince another student to murder Osana for you. \n\n There is a "Fragile" student at school who can't take bullying... \n\n If you convince girls to bully her, and then blame Osana for it... \n\n ...the "Fragile" student would feel justified in killing Osana.=他の生徒にOsanaを殺してもらい排除。\n\n「壊れやすい」性格の生徒はいじめに耐えられない...\n\nもしその生徒がいじめられるように誘導し、それをOsanaのせいにすれば...\n\n...「壊れやすい」子はOsanaを殺すだろう。

その他
To my darling daughter, \n\n By the time you're reading this, your father and I will be on an airplane headed for America! \n\n I wish that I could say it's a pleasure trip, but unfortunately, the reason why we're visiting America is actually quite unpleasant. I'll spare you the details, but to summarize the situation, your mommy has to tie up a loose end that should have been snipped a long time ago. \n\n I'm honestly not sure exactly how long we'll be gone for. We might be back in a few days, but it's also possible that we might be away for a few weeks. If that happens, I'll send you a postcard once per week just to let you know that we're alright! \n\n I know that you're a big girl who can take care of herself, but just to make sure that you'll be all right, I left a little bit of money in the fruit bowl in the kitchen. Feel free to spend it on anything you need! \n\n Back when I was your age, I ran into a lot of problems that made my school life quite difficult. But, I managed to eliminate every obstacle in my way - and I'm sure you will, too! If anyone tries to get between you and your dreams, promise me that you'll reject their nastiness and negativity! \n\n I know that you'll be okay on your own, as long as you remember all the lessons that I taught you throughout your childhood! \n\n With lots and lots of love, \n\n Your mommy and daddy=大切な娘へ \n\n あなたがこれを読んでいるころには、私とパパはアメリカ行きの飛行機に乗っているでしょう！\n\n楽しい旅行に行ってきます...と言いたいところだけど、アメリカに行くのはとっても不本意な理由なの。要約すると、ママは解決すべきなのに未解決のままにしていた問題を解決しに行くの。\n\n正直、どのくらい留守にするのかわからないわ。数日かもしれないし、数週間かもしれない。そのときは、毎週ハガキで無事だと伝えるわ。\n\nあなたはとっても自立した子だけど、念のためフルーツボウルにお金を少し入れておいたわ。好きに使ってね！\n\n私があなたぐらいの頃は、いろんな問題にぶつかって学校生活は大変だった。でも、私はどんな邪魔も排除してきた。あなたもきっと同じことをするわ！あなたの夢を阻む人が現れても、その人の悪意や否定に屈しないでね。ママとの約束よ。\n\n子供のころに教えたことをしっかり守ってれば、一人でもきっと大丈夫だからね！\n\n たくさんの、たくさんの愛を込めて \n\n 父と母より
To my precious daughter, \n\n I'm writing to let you know that your father and I will be staying in America for a little bit longer than I originally expected! I can't promise exactly when we'll return home, but I'm sure that you'll be okay without us. You've always been a very independent young woman! \n\n Has school been going smoothly? You might run into people who will try to block the path between you and the life you've always dreamed of. If that happens, I want you to fight back as fiercely as you can! Don't be afraid to turn up the heat and burn your problems to a crisp! \n\n By now, I bet you've spent all of the money that I left for you. But, don't worry - I have good news! I wasn't sure how long I would be gone for, so I left behind some extra money, just in case! If you open the refrigerator and search carefully, you'll find some money tucked away in there! \n\n Why did I keep this money a secret? Well, I didn't want you to spend it all at once, so I decided to hide some money in various places around the house that I knew you wouldn't check, and only reveal one hiding place per week, to make sure that the money lasts as long as possible! Clever, right? \n\n That's all I have to say for now, sweetheart! Take care of yourself, and make mommy and daddy proud! \n\n With oodles and oodles of love, \n\n Your mommy and daddy=大切な娘へ \n\nパパとママは予定より少し長くアメリカに滞在することになったわ。いつ帰国できるかはわからないけど、私たちがいなくてもきっと大丈夫。あなたはとっても自立した子だもの！ \n\n学校は順調？憧れの生活への道を邪魔する人に出くわすかもしれないわ。そんなときは思いっきりやり返しちゃいなさい！本気を出すのを怖がって手加減しちゃダメよ！ \n\n これまで、私たちが残したお金を使い切ってしまったんじゃないかしら。でも大丈夫よ！いつまで留守にするかわからなかったから、念のため余分なお金を残しておいたの！冷蔵庫を開けてよく探すと、お金がしまってあるわ。 \n\n なんで秘密にしてたのかって？一度に全部使われちゃうと困るから、家のあちこちに隠しておいたの。賢いでしょ？ \n\n 今はそれだけよ！体に気をつけて、パパやママの自慢の娘でいてね！ \n\n たくさんの、たくさんの愛を込めて \n\n 父と母より

Info Points=Infoポイント
Info-chan=インフォちゃん
Drops=ドロップ
DROPS=ドロップ
OBJECTS=品目
Services=サービス
SERVICES=サービス
Schemes=ガイド
SCHEMES=ガイド
Bounty=依頼
What do you need?=何が欲しいの？
How to earn Info Points=Infoポイントの入手方法
How to earn Info Points
Info-chan will provide you with the name, club, personality, crush, and schedule of any student you wish to know about.=指定した生徒の名前、部活、性格、好きな人、スケジュールを入手。
Increase Yandere-chan's reputation by 5 points.=Yanちゃんの評判を5ポイント増加。
Damage your rival's reputation by 5 points. Reputation can become a negative number. If your rival's reputation drops below -100, Senpai will not be able to accept her love confession. If her reputation drops below -150, she will commit suicide.=恋敵の評判に5ポイントのダメージ。評判はマイナスになることもあって、恋敵の評判が-100以下になるとセンパイへの告白は失敗、-150以下になると自殺をする。
Info-chan will sell you one of your rival's most embarassing secrets. This information will boost the strength of your gossip towards your rival, which will make it easier to eliminate her by ruining her reputation.=恋敵の恥ずかしい秘密。これでゴシップが強力になって恋敵の評判をおとしめて排除しやすくなる。
Info-chan will contact a student and give them (fake) devastating news about a family member. The student will leave school immediately.\n\nIf student portraits don't appear, back out of the menu, load the Student Info menu, then return to this screen.=インフォちゃんが指定した生徒に家族の衝撃的な知らせをでっちあげて、生徒を即帰宅させる。\n\n生徒の顔写真が表示されない場合、一度このメニューから戻って生徒情報の画面を開いてからこのメニューに戻ってください。
This service is only available if the police are en route to the school. Info-chan calls the police and tells them that the murderer they are looking for was spotted leaving the school. This will cause the police to search the area outside of the school for 5 minutes before entering.=警察が学校に呼び出されている状態でのみ有効。インフォちゃんが警察に連絡して殺人犯が学校を出ていったという目撃情報を流す。これで警察が周辺捜索に時間を割いて5分到着を遅らせることができる。
This service will unlock a dialogue option when being confronted by the Guidance Counselor.=カウンセラー室での秘密の選択肢を開放する。
Info-chan will provide you with a list of any student's likes and dislikes, which will become visible from their Student Profile, and also visible when socializing or gossipping with them.=指定した生徒の好き・嫌いの情報を入手。生徒情報とお喋り、ゴシップ画面で表示されるようになる。
Info-chan will get a student fired from the Student Council. That student will lose their pepper-spray, and it will become possible to interact with them as if they were a normal student.=指定した生徒が生徒会をクビになるように仕向ける。催涙スプレーを持たなくなり普通の生徒と同じように話しかけられるようになる。
Info-chan will sell you the information required to perform the "Befriend/Betray" elimination method on your rival.=この情報で「親友/裏切り」排除ができる。
This service can only be performed once per day.=このサービスは1日1回までしか実行できない。
This service can only be purchased once.=このサービスの購入は1度しかできない。
This service can only be performed once per week.=このサービスは週1回までしか実行できない。
This service can be performed multiple times in one day.=このサービスは1日に何度でも実行できる。
This service is not available right now.=このサービスは現在利用できません

サービス
Provide Student Info=生徒情報を入手
Improve My Reputation=自分の評判を上げる
Damage Rival Reputation=恋敵の評判を下げる
Provide Rival's Embarassing Secret=恋敵の恥ずかしい秘密を知る
Send Student Home=生徒を帰宅させる
Delay Police=警察の到着を遅らせる
Provide Counselor Info=カウンセラーの情報を入手
Provide Student Likes and Dislikes=生徒の好き嫌いの情報を入手
Fire Student Council Member=生徒会員をクビにさせる
Provide Rival's Dark Secrets=恋敵の暗い秘密を知る

ドロップ
Clean Uniform=清潔な制服
Pack of Cigarettes=煙草
A clean uniform. You can put it on if you are naked while inside of the school locker room. You can not put on clean clothing while you are still bloody.=清潔な制服です。ロッカールームの中で着ることができます。血がついたままの状態では、きれいな服を着ることはできません。
A pack of cigarettes. You can put this into a girl's desk and report her to the guidance counselor to get her in trouble. It may also have other uses, as well...=タバコの箱。これを女子の机の中に入れて、カウンセラーに報告すると退学ゲージが進行します。他の用途もあるかもしれません。
A lock-picking device. You can use this to pick any locked door in the school. It is very fragile, and will break after one use.=鍵を開ける道具。これを使えば、学校中の鍵のかかったドアを開けることができます。脆いので、1回使うと壊れます。
A headset and an earpiece. You can give the earpiece to a suitor and give them advice while they talk to their crush.=ヘッドセットとイヤホン。イヤホンを恋人候補の男子に渡すと、彼が片思いの相手と話している間にアドバイスできます。
A bottle of emetic poison. You can put this into someone's food to make them rush to the toilet.=催吐毒の瓶。誰かの食べ物に入れると、食べた人は急いでトイレに行きます。
A bottle of lethal poison. You can put this into someone's food to kill them.=致死毒の瓶。誰かの食べ物に入れると、その人を殺すことができます。
A bottle containing a substance that will induce a headache upon human consumption.=頭痛毒の瓶。
A bottle of sedative. You can put this into someone's food to make them drowsy. A drowsy student will rest in the school infirmary.=鎮静剤の入った瓶。これを誰かの食べ物に入れると、食べた人は眠くなり、学校の保健室で休みます。
A directional microphone. You can use this to record nearby conversations with your phone.=指向性マイク。近くにいる人の会話を携帯電話に録音することができます。
A fake ID. Allows you to purchase cigarettes and alcohol from a convenience store.=偽造身分証。コンビニでタバコやお酒を買うことができます。
A wad of cash. Specifically, it's $20. You can use this to purchase things in school, at home, or in town.=札束。金額2000円分。学校や家、街での買い物に使うことができます。
A box of 20 "bang snaps". You can throw these to create distractions a short distance away from yourself.=20個の爆竹。これを投げると、他人の注意を自分から離れたところへと逸らすことができます。
A box of 5 stink bombs. You can throw these to create a horrible stench that causes nearby people to leave the area.=5個の悪臭ボム。近くの人が逃げ出すようなひどい悪臭を放つことができます。
Smoke Bomb=発煙筒
A smoke bomb. This will completely obscure you for 5 seconds, allowing you to get away with anything without being seen.=発煙筒。5秒間他人の視線を遮ることができ、その間の行為を目撃されずに済む。
Sorry, this item's not available yet!=申し訳ありませんが、このアイテムはまだありません。
Garrote=ガロット
A garrote. You can use this weapon to kill silently and without creating blood pools.=ガロット。この武器で殺害すれば、悲鳴も、返り血も出されずに済む。
バウンティー
TODAY'S BOUNTY=今日の依頼
Horuda Puresu holds a grudge against group of girls who bullied her, and sometimes creates drawings of those girls dying violently. If I had a photo of her creating these drawings, I could blackmail her. \n\n If you send me a photo of Horuda creating violent illustrations, I'll reward you with 25 Info Points.=Horuda Puresuはいじめっ子を恨んでいて、彼女らを殺す絵を描くことがあるわ。その絵を描いている写真があれば、脅迫できるわ。\n\nもしHorudaが暴力的な絵を描いている写真をくれたら、25ポイントをあげるわ。
Kyuji Konagawa has been following Osana Najimi around school, spying on her for short amounts of time. This makes him seem like a creepy stalker. If I had a photo of him stalking Osana, I could blackmail him. \n\n If you send me a photo of Kyuji stalking Osana, I'll reward you with 25 Info Points.=Kyuji Konagawaは学校でOsana Najimiに付きまとっていて、短時間彼女を監視するような行動を繰り返しているわ。まるで気持ち悪いストーカーみたいよね。KyujiがOsanaをストーキングしている写真があれば、彼を脅迫できるわ。\n\nそんな写真を送ってくれれば、25ポイントあげるわ。
Otohiko Meichi always trips and falls on his face near the school gate when he arrives at school around 7:55 AM. If I had a photo of him lying face-first on the ground, I could blackmail him. \n\n If you send me a photo of Otohiko on the ground, I'll reward you with 25 Info Points.=Otohiko Meichiは7:55 AMに登校し、いつも校門で顔から転ぶわ。その写真があれば彼を脅迫できる。\n\nもしOtohikoが転んでいる写真をくれたら、25ポイントあげるわ。
Hazu Kashibuci's father strongly disapproves of Hazu's feminine hobbies, and would be outraged if he knew that Hazu spends most of his time at school practicing sewing. If I had a photo of him sewing, I could blackmail him. \n\n If you send me a photo of Hazu sewing in the sewing room, I'll reward you with 25 Info Points.=Hazu Kashibuciの父はHazuの趣味が女性っぽいことを酷く残念に思ってるわ。もし彼が学校でいつも裁縫の練習をしてるなんて知ったら激怒するでしょうね。裁縫中の写真があれば、彼を脅迫できるわ。\n\nもしそんな写真をくれれば、25ポイントあげるわ。
