Yep! You're a great cook!=うん！君は料理上手だね！
Oh, it makes me so happy to hear that!=そう言ってもらえると嬉しい！
I can't promise that I'll always be able to bring an extra bento to school...=いつも学校にお弁当を持ってくるのは無理だけど...
...but, it makes me really glad to know that you like my cooking!=私の料理を気に入ってくれてとても嬉しい！
Would you, um...like to walk home together...?...=あの、その...一緒に帰らない？
Sure, I'd be happy to!=いいよ、喜んで！
Yay! Let's go!=イエーイ！行きましょ！

水2a

Okay...here goes! I'm opening the box now, aaaaand...=よし、いくよ！今から箱を開けるよ！そして...
Wow - a Saikou DotMatrix! I've heard about these before!=わあ！Saikou DotMatrixじゃないか！前に聞いたことあるよ！

I'd like to know if you'll be free around lunchtime!=今日の昼休憩時間空いてるかどうか聞きたくて！

Oh? Sounds fun! Sure, I'll be free at lunchtime.=へえ、面白そうだね！うん、昼は空いてるよ。
Oh...good! Please meet me on the school rooftop for lunch, then.=ああ...良かった！それなら、お昼ご飯の時屋上で会える？
Man, what could it be? Now you've got me all curious...=何を見せてくれるのかな。気になってしょうがないよ...
Heh...I'm not trying to tease you, if that's what you think...=フフ...別にからかってるわけじゃないわ...
Oh, I'm sorry, I have to go now - I'll see you at lunchtime!=あら、ごめんなさい、もう行かなきゃ。じゃあお昼休憩にね！
Okay! See you later, then!=オーケー。また後でね！

水2a

Senpai...you're very important to me. I don't want to keep secrets from you.=センパイ...あなたは私にとって大事な人。何も秘密にしておきたくないの。
So...I'm going to confess the truth to you.=だから...真実を伝えたくて。
...huh? The truth? ...wait. Hold on...are you saying that you're actually...?!=...え？真実？...待って。まさか...実は君が...?!

And then, perhaps you can walk me home~=そのあと～家まで送ってほしいな～
Oh!! Of course!! I'd love to!!=も、もちろんいいよ！
Hehe~ Oh my~ So eager~ Hehehe~ Let's go, then~=えへへ～必死になっちゃって～。えへへへ～じゃあ、行こっか～

火2b(先輩省略)
Uhhhhh...hey, look, Senpai...=あの...その、センパイ...
Shoot...man, I feel bad about this...ah, this is hard...=悪いとは思ってるんだけど...あのね...
Look, I...I lost the book. I lost the book you lent me...=借りた本...あの本が見つからないの。
Hey - I'm really sorry about this. I'll buy you a new one, okay?=ねえ、本当にごめんなさい。新しいのを買うわ。だから...
I...oh, shoot. Ohhhhh, shoot. This is...this is bad, huh...=そ、そんな...最悪だわ...

Sonoko
月1
Senpai. I need to speak to you.=センパイ、話したいことがあります。
...oh? What can I do for you?=ん？なんだい？
Take this meal. Put it on your desk.=このお弁当をどうぞ。机の上に置いてください。
At lunchtime, eat it.=昼休みに食べてください。
...uh...sure...but...why...?...=...えっと...いいけど...なんで？
I'm testing a theory.=私の推理を証明するためです。
Uh...okay. I'll...do it, I guess.=まあ...うん。そうするよ...多分。
Meet me here at 5:15 PM and tell me how the bento tasted.=5:15にここで会ってお弁当の感想を教えてください。
...uh...sure...=...う、うん...
Thank you for your cooperation.=協力に感謝します。

月2a
Senpai. Please, tell me how the bento tasted.=センパイ、味はどうでしたか。
Uh...it was good. Great, actually.=まあよかったよ。美味しかった。
...hmm. So, she didn't tamper with it.=フム、妨害は無しですか...
Huh? What?! What exactly did you try to feed me?!=え？何？僕に変な物食べさせたの！？
I theorized that someone might try to sabotage my attempt to feed you.=何者かがお弁当に細工をすると思ったのです。
However, the bento was left alone. This rules out one theory.=しかし、お弁当はそのままだった。推理は間違いだったのですね。
I am sure that you must have many questions for me. However...=色々と聞きたいこともあるでしょう。しかし...
...I cannot say anything that may interfere with the investigation.=...これも捜査のためです。答えることはできません。
...I...don't really...appreciate being left in the dark like this...=...こんな...変なことに巻き込まれちゃ、納得できないよ...
I apologize. To make up for it, I will guard you on your walk home.=すみません。お詫びに、家まで護送しますね。

月2b(差分のみ、既出の先輩のセリフ省略)
Please, Senpai. I need to know=お願いします、センパイ。教えてください。知る必要があるんです。
...just as I expected. How bad was it?=...予想どおりです。おかしかったところはどこですか？
Damn it. I didn't think she'd go that far...=なんと。まさかそこまでするとは...
I don't know what this has to do with your investigation...=これで君の捜査がどれほど進むのか知らないけどさ...
...but I do NOT appreciate being left in the dark like this.=...こんな目に遭っておいて、納得なんてできないよ。
I'm not at liberty to explain the details...I'm sorry...=詳細まで説明するのは無理なんです...すみません...

Excellent. Hand it over.=よし、それでは渡してください。

I must apologize in advance if anything happens to this book.=この本がどうなるか分からないので、事前に謝っておきます。

But, if not...at least a theory of mine will be proven.=ですがそうならなかった場合...私の推理が証明されます。
Uh...okay...but, could you return it to me around 5:15 PM?=でも...5:15には返してもらうからね？
That would be acceptable.=ええ、分かりました。
Uh...alright...=なら...いいけど...

火2a
Uh...hey. So, uh...about the book...=ねえ、その...本についてだけど...
Here it is, in perfect condition.=ここにあります。無事です。
Phew. You made me worry that something was going to happen to it.=ふう、何か起こらないかと気が気じゃなかったよ。
I, too, had my suspicions that something bad would happen.=私もこの本に何かが起こると予想していました。
I'm still not certain what you hoped to achieve...=何が起こってほしかったのかまだ聞いてないんだけど...
I suspected that, if I borrowed something of value from you...=私の予想としては、あなたから何かを借りた後...
...a mysterious aggressor would appear and steal the object.=...何者かがそれを盗むために現れると思っていました。
I cannot tell you more than that without jeopardizing the investigation.=これ以上は捜査に支障が出るので言えません。
So, you're just...using my belongings as bait? Um...that's...kinda...=それってさ、僕のものを餌にしたってこと？それは...ちょっと...
I swear to you that one day, I will explain everything. Just not today.=今は話せませんが、言える日になったら全て話します。

火2b(既出の先輩のセリフ省略)
Senpai! Great news! My suspicions were correct!=センパイ！良い知らせです！私の推理は正しかった！
As expected, the book was stolen! The book you lent me!=予想通り、本が盗まれたんです！貸してくれた本が！
This proves my theory! I was right all along!=私の推理が証明されました！私は正しかった！
Wait a minute. My book is gone? It was stolen?=待ってよ、僕の本は？盗まれたの？
Ultimately, a trivial matter. I can just buy you a new one.=そんなことは些細な問題でしょう。新しいのを買ってあげますから。

水1

水2a
Senpai. Please open this box and tell me what's inside.=センパイ。この箱を空けて何が入ってるか教えてください。

...huh? ...what? ...it's...just empty?=...え？...空っぽ？

I anticipated that, if someone knew I was trying to give you a gift...=私があなたへプレゼントを渡そうとしてるとある人物が知れば...
...they would make some sort of attempt to sabotage it.=...その人物はそれを妨害すると予想したのです。

I'm sorry, Senpai...for the sake of the investigation, I can't tell you yet.=ごめんなさい、センパイ...捜査のためです。まだ言えません。

水2b(差分のみ)

Huh? What? Why would someone do that?=え？何でそんなことを？
Someone is attempting to sabotage my interactions with you.=私とあなたの関わりを邪魔したい人がいるということです。
But...but, why? What motive does anyone have to do that?=でも、なんで？邪魔をして何になるの？
Senpai...I know the answer to that question, but...=センパイ...その答えは知っていますが...
...you can't tell me because it would jeopardize the investigation.=...どうせ捜査に支障をきたすから言えないんでしょ。
Yes...you understand. I'm sorry for the secrecy, Senpai.=ええ...分かってくれましたか。すみません、センパイ。

木1

Apologize
Oh, that makes perfect sense! ...I guess.=ああ、なるほど！...分かったよ。
That was really freaky, so please don't do it again, okay?=とても気味が悪かったよ、だから二度としないで、いい？
I wasn't stealing! I just wanted to take a closer look at it for a moment.=盗もうとなんかしてない！ちょっと近くで見てみたかっただけ。
I found something dangerous, so I was taking it to a teacher.=危険なものを見つけたから先生に渡してきたの。
I'm so sorry for how I behaved earlier. I don't know what came over me.=本当にごめんなさい。自分でも何があったか分からないの。
Don't worry, it's not blood; it's just red paint.=大丈夫、血じゃなくてただの赤い絵の具。
I spilled red paint on myself! I'm going to go clean it off now.=赤い絵の具をこぼしちゃったの！落としてくるね。
I don't start fights! I was just defending myself!=喧嘩じゃない！自分の身を守ろうとしただけ！
It's a misunderstanding! I was taking a picture of something else, I swear!=誤解よ！別の物を撮ってたの、本当に！
I spilled something, and I want to clean it up right away.=こぼしちゃったものがあるから綺麗にしないと。
I swear I wasn't eavesdropping! I was just passing by!=盗み聞きしてたわけじゃないの！ただ通りかかっただけ！

The boy studies various different school subjects.  As a result, his Intelligence stat increases.=様々な科目を勉強することで、賢さが上昇しました
The boy exercises and runs on the school running track.  As a result, his Strength stat increases.=準備運動をしてから走り込み、運動神経が良くなった。
The boy stands in front of a painting that is rumored to be haunted until he is no longer afraid of it.  As a result, his Courage stat increases.=幽霊が出るとウワサの絵の前に立って怖さに慣れ、勇気が出せるようになった。

r:"^SUITOR STATS\n\nCOURAGE: (?<courage>\d+)\n\nINTELLIGENCE: (?<intelligence>\d+)\n\nSTRENGTH: (?<strength>\d+)$"=ステータス\n\n勇気: ${courage}\n\n賢さ: ${intelligence}\n\n強さ: ${strength}

Bracelet=ブレスレット
Your rival would appreciate this gift.=恋敵に渡せば喜んでもらえるだろう。

He tells her that he feels the same way.=彼も同じ気持ちでいると伝える。
The two of them share a tender kiss as sakura blossoms fall around them.=桜の花びらが舞い散る中、2人は甘いキスを交わす。


MATCHMAKING RESULTS=マッチメイク結果

sr:"^(?<hairstyle>Your rival (?:might like|likes) her suitor[^\n]+)\n\n(?<accessory>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes) [^\n]+|The suitor lacks [^\n]+)\n\n(?<facialware>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes) [^\n]+|The suitor lacks [^\n]+)\n\n(?<skin>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes) [^\n]+|The suitor lacks [^\n]+)\n\n(?<haircolor>Your rival (?:doesn't (?:seem to|like)|likes) [^\n]+)\n\n(?<jewelry>Your rival (?:doesn't seem to|likes|is disappointed) [^\n]+)\n\n(?<panties>Consider visiting the lingerie store [^\n]+|The panties you put on [^\n]+)\n\n(?<manga>You can provide the suitor [^\n]+|The romance manga [^\n]+)\n\n(?<psychology>You could provide the suitor [^\n]+|Your knowledge of psychology [^\n]+)$"=${hairstyle}\n\n${accessory}\n\n${facialware}\n\n${skin}\n\n${haircolor}\n\n${jewelry}\n\n${panties}\n\n${manga}\n\n${psychology}
Your rival might like her suitor better with a different hairstyle.=恋人候補の髪型は変えた方がよさそうだ
Your rival likes her suitor's hairstyle!=恋人候補の髪型は恋敵の好みだった！
The suitor lacks accessories that your rival finds appealing.=恋人候補に恋敵の気に入るようなアクセサリーを付けた方がよさそうだ
Your rival likes her suitor's piercings!=恋人候補のピアスは恋敵の好みだった！
The suitor lacks facialwear that your rival finds appealing.=恋人候補の顔立ちは変えた方がよさそうだ
Your rival likes her suitor's glasses!=恋人候補のメガネは恋敵の好みだった！
Your rival doesn't seem to have a preference regarding skin color.=恋敵は肌の色を気にしないようだ
Your rival likes her suitor's tan!=日焼け肌は恋敵の好みだった！
The suitor lacks a physical trait that your rival is attracted to.=肌の色を変えた方が良さそうだ
Your rival doesn't seem to have a preference regarding hair color.=恋敵は髪の色を気にしないようだ
Your rival likes her suitor's hair color!=髪色は恋敵の好みだった！
Your rival doesn't like her suitor's hair color.=髪色を変えた方が良さそうだ
Your rival doesn't seem to care whether or not someone is wearing jewelry.=恋敵は宝石を身に着けているかを気にしないようだ
Your rival likes her suitor's jewelry!=ジュエリーは恋敵の好みだった！
Your rival is disappointed that her suitor doesn't wear jewelry.=ジュエリーを着けさせた方が良さそうだ
Consider visiting the lingerie store in town to purchase panties that boost your matchmaking skill.=下着屋でマッチメイクの効果を向上させるパンツを買うことができます
The panties you put on this morning put you into the right mindset to give your suitor the best advice!=パンティーのお陰でマッチメイクの効果アップ！
You can provide the suitor with better advice if you visit the manga store in town, purchase romance manga, and read it at night.=商店街の書店で恋愛漫画を買い、自宅で読むことで、マッチメイクの効果が向上します
The romance manga you've been reading contained helpful advice for your suitor!=恋愛漫画のお陰でマッチメイクの効果アップ！
You could provide the suitor with better advice if you studied psychology at classtime.=心理学を伸ばせばマッチメイクの効果が向上します
Your knowledge of psychology improved the effectiveness of your advice!=心理学を学んでいたのでマッチメイクの効果アップ！

sr:"^(?<topics1>Your rival (?:disliked what|enjoyed what|was bored when) her suitor [^\n]+)\n\n(?<topics2>Your rival (?:disliked what|enjoyed what|was bored when) her suitor [^\n]+)\n\n(?<compliment>Your rival (?:enjoyed hearing|did not appreciate hearing|was bored when) [^\n]+)\n\n(?<gift>You did not provide [^\n]+|Your rival appreciated [^\n]+)\n\n(?<showoff>The suitor didn't have [^\n]+|Your rival (?:didn't really care|was impressed) [^\n]+)\n\nYour rival's affection for the suitor increased by (?<gained_i>\d+) points\.\n\n(?<moretogo>\d+ more points are required [^\n]+|Your rival is now in love [^\n]+)$"=${topics1}\n\n${topics2}\n\n${compliment}\n\n${gift}\n\n${showoff}\n\n恋敵にとっての恋人候補の好感度が${gained_i}ポイント上がった\n\n${moretogo}
sr:"^Your rival disliked what her suitor said about (?<topics>[A-Z][\w\s]+)\.$"=恋敵と恋人候補は${topics}の話をしたが盛り上がらなかった

sr:"^Your rival did not appreciate hearing (?<compliment>\x22[^\x22!]+!\x22)$"=恋敵は${compliment}と言われたが嬉しくなかった
You did not provide the suitor with a gift to give to your rival.=恋人候補に恋敵への贈り物は渡さなかった
sr:"^Your rival appreciated recieving a (?<gift>[A-Z][\w\s]+)\."=恋敵は${gift}を貰って喜んだ
sr:"^The suitor didn't have enough (?<stat>[A-Z][a-z]+) to impress your rival\."=恋人候補は${stat}が足りずうまく表現できなかった
sr:"^Your rival didn't really care when her suitor tried to show off his (?<stat>[A-Z][a-z]+)\."=恋人候補は${stat}を見せたが恋敵は興味を示さなかった

r:"^(?<more>\d+) more points are required in order to make your rival fall in love with her suitor\."=もう${more}ポイント稼ぐと恋敵は恋人候補が好きになるだろう
Your rival is now in love with her suitor! She will confess to him at 5:00 PM on Friday!=恋敵は恋人候補のことが好きになった！金曜の5:00に告白するだろう！

sr:"^Your rival was bored when her suitor said (?<compliment>\x22[^\x22!]+!\x22), because the suitor already said that on a previous day\.$"=恋敵は${compliment}と言ってもつまらなさそうだった、先日言ったのと同じ言葉だ。

This task has not been discovered yet.=このタスクはまだ発見されていません。
I'm sorry...I don't think there is anything you can help me with.=ごめん...今は困ってることとかは特にないから...

This task is for...=このタスクは...
This task is about...=このタスクは...
This student needs to write a report, but can't find the necessary information online. Help them get the info they need.=この学生はレポートの課題が出ていますが、必要な情報がネットで見つかりませんでした。\n情報収集を手伝ってあげてください。
Will you accept this task?=タスクを受注しますか？

This student needs to write a report, but can't find the necessary information online. Help them get the info they need.=この生徒はレポートを書いていますが、インターネットでは十分な情報が得られませんでした。情報が得られるものを探してきましょう。

This student wants someone to finish an annoying school assignment for them. Go to the library and complete the assignment.=この生徒は誰かに宿題を代わってほしいそうです。図書室に行って宿題を終わらせてあげましょう。

I'm so thirsty...I'm, like, dying of thirst over here...=今のどが渇いてて死にそうなんだ...
...what? Water? No way! Water is just so plain and simple and BORING! If I'm going to drink something, I want it to be delicious, you know?!=え？水？水って地味だし飽きるよ！どうせ飲むなら美味しいのがいいなあ。
I'd love to buy a soda from one of the vending machines, but I'm flat broke...=自販機でソーダを買いたいけど、お金ないし...
This student is thirsty. Go purchase a drink for them from a vending machine. Vending machines can be found on the 2nd floor cafeteria or the outdoor cafeteria.=この生徒はのどが渇いています。自販機で飲み物を買ってあげましょう。自販機は2階カフェテリアや外のカフェテリアにあります。
This student is thirsty. Go purchase a drink for them from a vending machine. Vending machines can be found on the 2nd floor cafeteria ro the outdoor cafeteria.=この生徒はのどが渇いています。自販機で飲み物を買ってあげましょう。自販機は2階カフェテリアや外のカフェテリアにあります。
Aw, man...why didn't I think of bringing any money to school with me today...=はぁ...お金持ってくればよかったよ...
Whoa - you would actually buy me a drink?! Wow! That would be super generous of you!=えっ、飲み物買ってくれるの！？めっちゃ太っ腹だね！
A drink! For me?! Really?! You've saved my life! I'll never forget this!=飲み物！くれるの？本当に！？君は命の恩人だよ！このことは絶対忘れないから！

Hey, you know those collectible wooden toys that were super popular a few years ago? My little sister got super attached to hers, but she accidentally broke part of it.=何年か前に流行った木の人形知ってる？妹が大事にしてたその人形が壊れちゃってさ...
She's been really depressed about it. I offered to buy her a new one, but she doesn't want a replacement - she wants the old one to be fixed.=それですごく落ち込んでるんだ。新しいの買おうって言ったんだけど、新しいのはいらないから修理してって言われたんだ。
I brought it to school because I thought that I might be able to repair it in the school workshop, but...honestly, I have no idea how to fix it.=もしかしたら学校の技術室で直せないかと思って持ってきたけど、実は直し方全然わからなくてさ。
This student wants to fix their young sibling's broken toy. Go to the Workshop on the 2nd floor and repair the broken toy.=この生徒は妹の人形を直したいようです。2階の技術室で直してあげましょう。
Do you think if I bought her a new one, she would even be able to tell the difference...?=もし新しいの買ったらバレちゃうかな？
You want to give it a try? Sure, go ahead. It's not like it can get much worse than it already is.=試しに直してみるって？どうぞ。これ以上悪化することはなさそうだし。
Hey! You did it! You actually did it! It's fixed! My sister is going to be so happy when she sees this! Thanks a lot!=すごい！直してくれたんだ！本当に直ってる！妹もきっと喜ぶよ！ありがとう！

Oh man, get a load of this: my friend brought an inappropriate magazine to school, and the student council confiscated it from him. What a dork, right?!=ちょっと聞いてよ！友達が学校に雑誌を持ってきてたんだけど、生徒会に没収されちゃったんだ！馬鹿げてるよ！
Anyway, my friend really wants his magazine back. He knows that he could just sneak into the Student Council room and take it when nobody's around, but he's afraid that somebody will see him.=それでさ、その友達が本を取り戻したがってるんだ。生徒会室に忍び込んで本を盗むしかないけど、誰かに見られるのが怖くてできないらしいんだ。
So, he's going around and asking people if they would be willing to go into the student council room and steal his magazine back. Haha...man...my friend sure is a dork, isn't he? Ha...haha...=それで、誰かが友達の代わりに生徒会室に行って雑誌を取り返してくれないかなあって。ハハハ...そんな人いるわけないのにね。ハハハ...
This student wants a magazine that was confiscated by the Student Council. Go to the Student Council Room on the 2nd floor and retrieve the confiscated magazine.=この生徒は生徒会に没収された雑誌を取り返したいようです。2階の生徒会室に行き、雑誌を取り返しましょう。
...haha...yeah...who in their right might would accept such a weird task...ha...haha...hahaha...=...ハハハ...こんな頼み聞いてくれる人いないよねえ...ハハハ...
Really?! You'll give it a try?! Awesome! I think the magazine is inside of a desk. Good luck!=本当！？やってくれるの！？多分雑誌は机の中にあるから、頑張ってね！
Hey! That's my mag - I mean - that's MY FRIEND'S magazine! You got it back! Oh, man...my friend is going to be so happy when he sees this! Thanks a bunch!!=お！それはうちの...いや、ト・モ・ダ・チ・の雑誌じゃないか！取り返してくれたんだ！友達もきっと喜ぶよ！ありがとう！

My friend collects landscape paintings. I want to give her a painting as a present, but they're super expensive. I decided to try making a painting myself, but there's just one little problem...=友人が風景画を描いてて、その子に絵をプレゼントしたいんだけど、すっごく高価でさぁ。自分で描こうとしたんだけど、ちょっと問題があってさあ...
My painting SUCKS! It's not just embarrassing, it's outright shameful! There's no way I could ever let my friend see this thing - it would come across as an insult!=絵が全然上手くならないんだ！恥ずかしながら、こんなの友達に見せられないよ！侮辱にしか見えないよ！
I wish that someone could just...take my painting to the Art Room and FIX it for me! Sure, it wouldn't be my painting anymore, but at least I'd have a gift to give my friend, you know?=だからさ、誰かが絵を手直ししてくれないかなーって！そしたら自分で描いた絵ってわけではなくなるけど、少なくともプレゼントできるものになると思うんだ。
This student wants their painting to be improved. Go to the Art Room on the 3rd floor and improve their painting.=この生徒は絵を改善してほしいようです。3階の芸術室に行き絵を手直ししてあげましょう。
Yeah, I don't blame you for saying no. This painting is a lost cause. Ah, what a shame...=まあ、そうだよね。この絵はもうダメだ...残念だけど...
Oh, you want to try fixing it? Sure, be my guest! I wish you good luck...you'll certainly need it.=手直ししてくれるの？どうぞ！よい絵になりますように！
Huh?! What?! No way...I don't believe it. You actually made my painting into something worthy of showing my friend! She's going to absolutely love this! Thank you so much!=うおお...！？信じられない。あの絵がこんなに良くなるなんて！きっと友達も喜ぶよ！本当にありがとう！

My friends are trying to start a band, but they're having trouble spreading awareness about their performances...=友達がバンド組もうとしてるんだけど、知名度が低くて困ってるらしいんだ...
They designed a flyer and asked me to use the copying machine at school to print a bunch of copies. I agreed to help them out, but...I don't actually know how to use the copying machine!=チラシをコピー機で印刷して配って欲しいって頼まれたんだけど、実はコピー機の使い方がわからないんだ！
I don't want to ask the faculty for help, because I'm worried they'll get upset at me for trying to use the copying machine for non-academic purposes. I don't know who else to ask for help, though...=先生に相談しても「学業に関係ないことに使うな！」って怒られそうだし、誰に頼めばいいのやら...
This student wants copies of a flyer. Go to the Computer Lab on the 3rd floor and make copies of their flyer.=この生徒はチラシをコピーしたいようです。3階のパソコン室に行きコピーしてきましょう。
Um, please don't tattle on me to the teachers! I really don't want to get in trouble...=先生にチクらないでね！困ったことになるから...
Oh? You're good with computers? Here, take the flyers - please, make as many copies as possible!=え？やってくれるの？コレ、このチラシをお願い！できるだけ沢山ね！
Ah! You did it! You made copies of the flyers! This is exactly what I needed! Thank you very much!=コピーしてくれたんだ！これが欲しかったんだよ！ありがとう！

I'm having trouble with one of my assignments. It's for my least favorite school subject...=実は宿題が上手くいかなくてさ...一番苦手な科目の宿題なんだけど。
I hate this stupid assignment so much! At this point, I just want someone else to do it for me!=この宿題がマジで無理でさ...ここだけでいいから誰かにやってほしくて。
If you're willing to complete the assignment for me, please do it where nobody will see you. The table in the library should be perfect.=もし代わりにやってくれるなら、誰にも見てないところでやってほしい。図書室の机とか。
This student is struggling with an annoying school assignment. Go to the Library and complete the assignment for them.=この生徒は誰かに宿題を代わってほしいそうです。図書室に行って宿題を終わらせてあげましょう。
I can't blame you for saying no, but I had to take a chance. This assignment sucks! Argh!=断られても仕方ないよね...でも、この宿題ほんとに酷いよ！あーあ！
Really?! You'll help me?! Thank you!=本当に！？ありがとう！
Oh my god, you did it! Now this stupid assignment is finally behind me once and for all! Thank you!=うわあ！やってくれたの！もうあんな宿題とはオサラバだ！ありがとう！

I skipped breakfast today, so I'm SUPER hungry! I really want an extra meal!=今日朝ご飯食べてなくてさ、ほんっっとうにお腹空いてるんだよね！ご飯食べたい...
I know that there's a bunch of ingredients in the Home Ec room, and that anyone is welcome to prepare food in there. But, I'm a horrible cook. I would just screw up and waste the ingredients...=食材が家庭科室にあるし、誰でも料理していいらしいんだ。でも料理なんてできないし、食材をダメにしちゃうかも...
I wish that an angel would descend from heaven and just...give me a free meal!=天界から天使がやってきてご飯をくれたらなあ...
This student is hungry. Go to the Home Ec Room on the 1st floor and prepare a meal for them.=この生徒はお腹が空いているようです。1階にある家庭科室に行き料理を作ってあげましょう。
Ahh, man...I'll have to listen to my stomach rumbling for the rest of the day...=ああ...今日は一日中お腹が鳴りつづけるんだろうなあ...
Whoa, really? You'll make me a meal? Hey, I would appreciate that a whole lot!=え、本当に？作ってくれるの？本当にありがとう！
Oh, wow! Is that meal for me?! It looks delicious! Thank you! You've saved me from starvation!=うわぁ、これをくれるの！？美味しそう！ありがとう！これでお腹もふくれるよ！

Brrrrr...I'm so cold! I know that this weather is perfect for everyone else, but for me, it's just too chilly!=ブルブル...寒い！みんなにとってはちょうどいい気温なんだろうけど、寒がりには辛いよ！
I've been like this ever since I was a little kid...I always need to be wearing a jacket or something, or else I'm just freezing.=小さい頃からこんな感じでさ、上着とか着てないと寒くて寒くて...
I wish I had learned how to sew, so I could go to the Sewing Room and knit myself a scarf or something...=裁縫を習ってれば裁縫室でマフラーとか編めるのになあ...
This student is cold. Go to the Sewing Room on the 1st floor and sew a scarf for them.=この生徒は寒いようです。1階の裁縫室に行きマフラーを編んであげましょう。
Geez...how can anyone tolerate these freezing temperatures...=はぁ...どうしてみんなは寒くないのかな...
What? You're going to...get me a scarf? If you're being serious...I would really appreciate that!=え、マフラーを編んでくれるの！？本当にありがとう！
Oh my gosh! You really did it! You brought me a scarf! Wait - did you make this yourself?! Just now?! You're amazing! Thank you - I really owe you one!=うわあ！本当に編んでくれたんだ！待って、これキミがやったの？こんなに速く？すごすぎでしょ！ありがとう、恩に着るよ！

Argh...my head hurts like hell right now. I wish I had some headache pills...=うっ...頭痛が...薬とかがあればいいんだけど...
Yeah, yeah, I know I could just go to the infirmary and ask the nurse for help, but I don't like going to the infirmary, because...ugh...you're going to make fun of me for this, I know it...=いや、わかってる。保健室の先生に頼めば薬くれるんでしょ。でも保健室行きたくなくて...なんでって？その...バカにされそうだから言いたくないんだけど...
I'm afraid of the anatomical model in the infirmary, okay?! It's gross and nasty and it creeps me out! I don't want to go anywhere near it! I still really need headache pills, though...=保健室の人体模型が怖いんだよ！グロいし気持ち悪いしゾっとするじゃん！近づきたくないよ！でも薬はほしくて...
This student is suffering from a headache. Go to the Infirmary on the 1st floor and ask the nurse for pills that will alleviate headache symptoms.=この生徒は頭痛で辛いようです。1階にある保健室に行き先生から薬をもらいましょう。
Damn that anatomical model...I've had nightmares about it ever since I first saw it...=あの人体模型...一度見てから何度も夢に見るんだ...
You're willing to talk to the nurse and get some headache pills for me? I'd really like that!=薬をもらってきてくれるの？ありがとう！
You actually went to the infirmary and got me some headache pills?! Thank you - you're a lifesaver!=薬持ってきてくれたんだ！ありがとう！命の恩人だよ！

Don't make fun of me for saying this, but...I have a crush on a girl. And...I want to give her a romantic gift. I heard that she loves roses, so...I've decided to find a rose and give it to her.=こんなこと言うとバカにされそうだけど、実は好きな子がいてさ。その女子にロマンチックな贈り物をしたくて、その子が好きなバラを贈りたいんだ。
I think I remember hearing something about a rose bush somewhere on school grounds. I've looked almost everywhere, but I just can't find it! I'm starting to doubt that it even exists!=校舎裏のグラウンドにバラがあるって聞いて探したんだけど見つからなかったんだ！本当にあるのか不安になってきたよ！
How about you? Have you heard anything about a rose bush at school? Do you know where it might be? If so, could you bring me a rose?=キミはバラのこと聞いたことある？どこにあるか知らない？よかったら一つ摘んできてくれない？
This student wants a rose. Find the only rose bush in school and obtain a rose for them. The rose bush is somewhere nearby the school gym.=この生徒はバラがほしいようです。バラを摘んで持ってきてあげましょう。バラは体育館の近くにあります。
Man, I did NOT realize how weird that sounded until I said it out loud. Sorry to bother you...=いやぁ、よくよく考えたらこんなお願いするの変だよね。邪魔してごめんよ...
You're going to look for it?! Thank you! I'll be grateful forever if you can bring me a rose!=探してくれるの！？ありがとう！バラを持ってきてくれたら一生恩に着るよ！
No way - a rose! You actually found one! With this, I feel like I might be able to make a good impression on the girl I like! Thank you!=バラだ！見つけてくれたんだ！これで好きな子と仲良くなれるかも！ありがとう！

Kuu Dereのタスク
Someone borrowed a book from the school library and never returned it. When I asked her to return the book, she confessed that she had lost it somewhere, and had been desperately trying to locate it.=図書室に未返却の本があるの。借りた人に聞いたら失くしてしまったみたいで、いくら探しても見つからないそうなの。
It was a rare, out-of-print book, and it would be a terrible shame if it was lost to us forever. I would be eternally grateful if someone was able to locate the book and return it to the library.=貴重な絶版本なのよ。もしずっと見つからないなんてことになったら残念だし、誰か見つけて返却してくれるとすごく助かるのだけど。
The book was solid black, with a fancy silver design on the cover. She said that the last time she remembered holding it, she was in one of the Zen gardens at school. Not sure which one, though...=黒地に銀のオシャレな本なの。覚えている限り学校の禅庭園で持ってたのが最後らしいわ。どっちの庭園なのかまでは分からないけれど...
Kuu Dere is searching for a missing book. It has a solid black cover and was last seen in one of the school's Zen gardens.=Kuu Dereは紛失した本を探しています。\n黒地の表紙で分かっている限り禅庭園で見かけたのが最後らしい。
How unfortunate.=残念
If you find the book, please bring it back to me.=もし見つけたら、持ってきてね。
Incredible. You actually found it. How exhilarating. I'm so happy. I can't find the words to express how grateful I am. I will never forget this moment for as long as I live. I am forever in your debt.=すごい。見つけたのね。感謝の念に堪えないわ。この恩は一生忘れない。ありがとね。

Normally, I would just walk around school, hand out samples, and ask for opinions...but, right now, I'm way too busy to do that...=普段は学校中を歩いて、試食してもらって感想を聞くんだけど...今は少し忙しくて...

Amai Odayaka wants nine people to taste-test her latest culinary creation. Grab her dish from the Home Ec fridge, hand out samples to nine people, and report back to her.=Amai Odayakaは9人の生徒に最新作を試食してほしいと思っています。家庭科室の冷蔵庫から新しい料理を取り出し、9人の生徒に配って、感想を報告しましょう。

Ryutoのタスク
I took off my bandana to adjust it, and a gust of wind just - WHOOSH - blew it right out of my hands!=バンダナを調整しようと脱いだら、風で飛ばされちゃったんだ。
I can sense that my bandana is still somewhere on the school grounds. I can feel its energy!=僕のバンダナは、まだ校内のどこかにあるはずだ。エナジーをビシビシ感じるんだよ。
I feel naked without my bandana...but I can't find it anywhere! Would you pleeeeease bring it to me if you find it?=でも見つからないんだ。どうか、見つけたら持ってきてくれないかな？
Ryuto Ippongo has lost his bandana. Locate his bandana and return it to him.=Ryuto Ippongoはバンダナをなくし\nました。見つけ出して渡しましょう。
I knew you wouldn't understand...nobody understands the bond between me and my bandana...=やっぱりダメか...誰も僕とバンダナの絆を理解してくれないんだよ...
Please, hurry! Without my bandana, I can feel my...life force...draining...=お願い！急いで！バンダナが無いと、僕の生命力が...失われていく...
My bandana! You found it! Oh, you have saved my life! I'll be in your debt forever! Forever and ever! Unless you, like, kill someone right in front of me, or something like that, ahahaha!=僕のバンダナ！見つけてくれたんだね！君は命の恩人だよ！一生恩に着るよ！目の前で殺人でもしない限りはね、アハハ！

pippiのタスク
I bought a used copy of the Yanvania re-release, but the game always crashes right after the first boss!=中古でYanvaniaを買ったんだけど、最初のボスを倒したら毎回クラッシュするの！
I'm not sure if there's a problem with the disc, or if there's a problem with my SaikouStation 4.=でもディスクの問題か私のSaikouStation 4の問題かわからなくて。
Would you please take this disc home with you, play it, and tell me if the game crashes after the first boss?=このディスク、家に持って帰ってプレイしてみてくれない？最初のボスでクラッシュするのかどうか教えて？
Pippi Osu wants to know if her console is defective. Play her disc on your game console at home, beat the first boss, and tell her what happens next.=Pippi Osuはゲーム機の故障を疑ってい\nます。自宅のゲーム機で借りたゲームを遊び、最初のボスを倒した後にどうなったかを伝えましょう。
Oh! Oops! I guess I shouldn't have just presumed that you'd have a SaikouStation 4...sorry...=ああ！そうね。SaikouStation 4持ってるとは限らないもんね...ごめんね...
You'll do it? Thank you so much! I really appreciate it!=やってくれるの？ありがとう！感謝するわ！
So, it crashed for you, too, huh? Well, now I know there's nothing wrong with my SS4. You can keep the disc. Thanks for your help!=そう、あなたのハードでもクラッシュしたんだ？じゃあ私のSS4は大丈夫ってことね。そのディスクならあげるわ。ありがとね！

Geijuのタスク
Titanium White.=チタンホワイト。
It's missing.=ないんだ。
How unfortunate.=残念
Geiju Tsuka needs a bucket of white paint, but apparently, the white paint has gone missing. He does not seem to know where it might be. Search in the logical locations, locate the paint bucket, and bring it to hime.=Geiju Tsukaは白い絵の具をなくして困っ\nているようです。場所の見当もつかないそうです。どこにあるのか推理して持って来てあげましょう。
Geiju Tsuka needs a bucket of white paint, but apparently, the white paint has gone missing. He does not seem to know where it might be. Search in the logical locations, locate the paint bucket, and bring it to him.=Geiju Tsukaは白い絵の具をなくして困っ\nているようです。場所の見当もつかないそうです。どこにあるのか推理して持って来てあげましょう。
Oh, well.=そうか。
Much appreciated.=助かる。
Good job!=やるね！

Budoのタスク
I'm sorry, it's a little difficult for me to confide in a complete stranger. If you befriend all of my clubmembers, I'd be able to trust you.=見ず知らずの人に打ち明けるのは気が引けるな！部員全員と仲良くしてくれれば、信用できるんだが...
My students tell me that they appreciate my lessons, but...I feel like I still have a long way to go before I can consider myself a good teacher. I'm nowhere near as skilled as my former mentor!=教え子たちからはよく感謝されるんだが、いい先生と言えるには、俺はまだまだ未熟な気がするんだ。前の部長に比べたら、まだまだだよ。
She quit martial arts, but...she still attends the school. I want to ask her to come back to the club for one last lesson...so I can study her teaching techniques! But...there's...just one problem.=あの人は格闘技を辞めたんだが、まだ学校にいる。最後に一回だけ部に来てもらって、あの人の教え方を勉強したいんだ。でも、一つ問題があってね...
I sometimes wonder if...I may have contributed to the reason why she quit martial arts. I'm not sure whether or not it would be awkward for me to approach her and ask her to visit to the club again...=あの人が武道をやめたのは、俺のせいじゃないかと思うことがあるんだ。もう一度部活に来ないかと誘うには気が引けて...
Budo Masuta wants the former president of the Martial Arts Club to return and share her wisdom. Indentify the former president and invite her to the club.=Budo Masutaは武道部の前部長に教えの技術を学びたいと思っています。前部長を探して武道部の活動に呼びましょう。
Oh! Don't mind me, I'm just...thinking out loud. I don't actually want to trouble anyone with my problems.=ああ、気にしないでくれ！ちょっと...考え事をしていただけだ。誰にも迷惑はかけられないからな。
...really? You'd be willing to speak to her on my behalf? I'd appreciate that a lot!=...本当に？俺の代わりにあの人と話してくれるのか？とてもありがたいよ！
Would you be willing to visit the Martial Arts Club and share some words of advice with the members?=武道部に行ってみない？部員たちにアドバイスしてほしいんだって。
Oh, I would be more than happy to visit the martial arts club! It'll be so nice to see Budo again! I'll head there right away. I'm sure Osana will be fine by herself for a little while, right?=行きたい！またBudo君に会えたら嬉しいわ！さっそく行ってくるね。ちょっとの間なら、Osanaも一人で大丈夫でしょ？
Wow! She's a lot more comfortable here than I expected. It was wrong of me to assume that things would be awkward between us; petty grudges are far beneath her! Thank you so much for your help!=思ったより楽しんでくれているようで何よりだ。久しぶりに戻ってきてもらっても気まずいんじゃないかと思っていたが、杞憂だったよ。本当にありがとう。

Sho Kuninのタスク
Recently, the only people I've been sparring with are the other members of the martial arts club. I value the lessons I've learned from them...but I'm worried about something.=最近さ、武道部のみんなとしかスパーリングできてないんだよね。みんなからは色んなことを学んできたけど、少し問題があってね。
I'm starting to fear that if I don't branch out and find new partners to spar with, I'll never learn anything new or grow as a martial artist.=新しいスパーリング相手を見つけないと、新しいことを学べないし、成長できないんじゃないかって思うんだ。
I want to spar with someone who can beat me in combat. If I suffer the agony of defeat, then surely, I will learn where my weaknesses are, and I'll be able to improve as a fighter.=僕を倒せるくらい強い人と戦いたいんだ。負けて悔しい想いをすれば、自分の弱点も分かるし、もっと強くなれそうでしょ？
Sho Kunin wants to fight a worthy opponent. Speak to Budo inside his clubroom and arrange a fight with Sho.=Sho Kuninは強い相手と戦いたいらしい。\n部室でBudoと話して、Shoと戦ってみましょう。
I see. Don't worry, I won't take it personally.=分かった。気にしないでくれ。
That's great news! Talk to Budo and let him know you want to have a match with me.=良かった！Budoに話しかけて君と僕でスパーリングするって伝えてくれ！
That was...quite a humbling experience. I didn't expect you to claim victory so easily! Clearly, I have been overestimating my abilities. You've taught me a very valuable lesson today...thank you!=とっても屈辱的だったよ。まさかこんなに簡単に負けちゃうなんて！自分の力を過信してたみたいだ。今日は大事なことを学んだよ...ありがとう！

Juku Renのタスク
Ugggggh...everyone else in the Martial Arts Club is so much stronger than me! It's so frustrating to lose every single sparring match...=うぐぐ...武道部のみんなは強すぎるんだ！スパーリングでいっつも負けちゃって散々だよ...
I guess I have to face the facts...no matter how badly I want to be a martial artist, there's just a hard limit to what my wimpy little noodle arms can do...=それで、やっぱり腕が細いままだと武道の達人にはなれないのかなって思ってさ...
I need to work out and get stronger! I heard there are some dumbells at school...but I searched all over the place, and I couldn't find them! Do you know where they are? Could you bring one to me?=筋トレしようと決めたんだ！学校のどこかにダンベルがあるって聞いたんだけど、なかなか見つからなくてさ、どこにあるか知らない？できれば持ってきて欲しいんだ。
Juku Ren wants to develop his muscles. Bring him a dumbbell. You can conceal a dumbbell inside of a bucket to transport it discreetly.=Juku Renは筋トレをしたいそうです。\nダンベルを持ってきてあげましょう。ダンベルはバケツにしまうと目立たずに運べます。
Juku Ren wants to develop his muscles. Bring him a dumbbell. You can place a dumbbell into a bucket to transport it discreetly.=Juku Renは筋トレをしたいそうです。\nダンベルを持ってきてあげましょう。ダンベルはバケツにしまうと目立たずに運べます。
Oh...I'm sorry...I, uh, didn't realize how weird my question was until after it came out of my mouth...heh...whoops...=あ、ごめん。変だよね、こんなお願いするなんて...ハハハ...
Hey, thanks! Uh, I apologize in advance if anyone looks at you funny because you're running around school with a dumbbell in your hands. Once you've got it, just drop it next to me and let me know!=ありがとう！ダンベルを持ち運んでたら変な目で見られそうだし、先に謝っておくよ。見つけたら、僕の近くに置いといてね！
Great! But, there's...just one problem. People WILL freak out if they see you running through school with a dumbbell. So...put it in a bucket, drop the bucket next to me, and I'll take it from there!=ありがとう！ダンベルを持ち運んでたら変な目で見られそうだし、バケツに入れて持ってきてね。僕の近くに来たら、バケツから出して話しかけて！
Thanks! Oh, there's, uh, one little problem. People WILL freak out if they see you running through school with a dumbbell. So, just...put it in a bucket, drop the bucket next to me, and I'll take it from there! Easy peasy!=ありがとう！でもダンベルを持ち運んでるのを見られたら絶対変な目で見られるし、バケツに入れて持ってきてよ！バケツを僕の近くに置いてからまた話しかけてね！
Is that dumbbell for me? Drop it over here!=ダンベル持ってきてくれたの？こっちに置いて！
Oh! Hey! You found one! Where was it? Nevermind - I don't need to know. All I need to do now is pump iron and get swole! Big gains, here I come!=見つけてくれたんだ！どこにあったの？まあいっか。今はただ、鋼の肉体目指して筋トレだ！
Thanks! I'll just pick it up, and - hnnnnngh - oh, geez, it's worse than I thought. I can't even lift this thing! Guess I'll have to start with something lighter. I still appreciate your help, though.=ありがとう！早速持ち上げてみよう...うわ、めちゃくちゃ重いじゃん！持ち上げられないよ！もっと軽いもので鍛えることにしようかな。でも助かったよ。ありがとね。

Mina Raiのタスク
Have you visited the beautiful Zen gardens on the east and west sides of the school? They're so calm and tranquil...but, apparently, not everyone respects them as much as I do.=校舎の東西にある禅の庭園に行ったことある？とっても静かで落ち着くんだけど、みんながあそこを大切に思ってるわけじゃないみたいなの。
I'm not sure who did it, but SOMEone tracked a bunch of mud inside of the building in the east Zen garden. I desperately want to clean it up, but I can never find a good opportunity to do so...=誰かが泥だらけの靴で東の庭園に入ったみたいなの。掃除したいんだけど、なかなか時間が無くて...
I hope this isn't too much to ask, but...would you mind mopping up the muddy shoeprints for me? It should be easy if you add bleach to a bucket of water and dip a mop into it...=無理なお願いかもしれないけど、泥の足跡を掃除してくれない？バケツの水に漂白剤を入れて、モップを浸せばすぐに綺麗になるはずだけど...
Mina Rai is disappointed that someone tracked muddy shoeprints inside of the tea house in the zen garden on the east side of the school. Fill a bucket with water, add bleach to the bucket, dip a mop in the bucket, and use the mop to clean up the shoeprints.=Mina Raiは東の庭園にある茶室に汚い足\n跡が付いて\nがっかりしています。バケツに水を入れて漂白剤を加え、モップを浸し、足跡を掃除しましょう。
Mina Rai is disappointed that someone tracked muddy shoeprints inside of the zen garden on the east side of the school. Fill a bucket with water, add bleach to the bucket, dip a mop in the bucket, and use the mop to clean up the shoeprints.=Mina Raiは東の庭園に汚い足跡が付いて\nがっかりしています。バケツに水を入れて漂白剤を加え、モップを浸し、足跡を掃除しましょう。
Oh, that's wonderful! I'm so glad that there are other people out there who care about keeping the gardens clean.=ありがとう！庭園を大切に思ってる人が私以外にもいてくれて嬉しいわ！
Tsk, tsk...what a shame...=あ、そう...残念だわ...
You cleaned up the mud? I'm so happy to hear that! I wish more people in the world were as considerate as you are. Thank you!=掃除してくれたの？嬉しいわ！みんながあなたみたいな思いやりのある人だったらいいのにね！ありがとう！

Shima Shiyaのタスク
Oh, gosh...I'm gonna be in suuuuuch big trouble when he finds out...=実は...今すっっっごく困ってて...
Budo warned me a million times not to perform wrestling moves on the wooden dummy in the clubroom...but I didn't listen. When nobody was around, I suplexed the dummy, and...it broke!=部室の人形にプロレスの技をかけるなって部長から注意されてたんだけど、ついやっちゃって。誰も見てなかったからいいけど、人形が壊れちゃったの！
It doesn't LOOK broken, but...all the limbs are loose now. I think it might be possible to fix the limbs with a wrench, but...I don't want to mess up and break it even more than I already did!=パッと見壊れてはないんだけど、手足が緩んじゃって。レンチで直せそうだけど、壊しちゃいそうで怖いの！
It doesn't LOOK broken, but...all the limbs loose now. I think it might be possible to fix the limbs with a wrench, but...I don't want to mess up and break it even more than I already did!=パッと見壊れてはないんだけど、手足が緩んじゃって。レンチで直せそうだけど、壊しちゃいそうで怖いの！
Shima Shiya loosened the joints of the wooden training dummy inside the Martial Arts Club. Obtain a wrench from the pump room underneath the school swimming pool and use the wrench to fix the dummy's broken limbs.=Shima Shiyaは武道部室の木製の人形の\n手足を緩めてしまいました。プールの下にあるポンプ室からレンチを入手し、人形の手足を直しましょう。
Ohhhhh, Budo's gonna kiiiiill meeeee...=そんなああぁぁ！部長に殺されちゃうよおおーー！
You'll fix it?! Really?! Thank you!! I think there's a wrench in the pump room underneath the school pool. Just...don't let anyone see you running around with a wrench. It'll...probably look weird.=直してくれるの！？ありがとう！確かレンチはプールの下のポンプ室にあったよ！でも、レンチを持ち運んでるのを誰かに見られないように気を付けてね！勘違いされちゃうかもだから！
You fixed it?! Thank you so much!! I'll never suplex another dummy for as long as I live!=直してくれたの！？ありがとう！！もう人形にスープレックスしたりしないわ！
Are you going to use that pipe wrench to fix the training dummy?=そのパイプレンチで人形を直してくれるの？

gitaのタスク
Our club leader was a totally different person last year. She had different hair, a different fashion sense...in fact, she had a completely different personality altogether!=うちの部長ってここ一年ですごく変わっちゃって。髪型とか、ファッションとか、性格も前は全然違ったの。
Of course, we all accept her for who she is, and we respect whoever she wants to be, but...I'm not sure if we're seeing her true self right now, or if she's just putting on a really elaborate act.=もちろん私たちはありのままのリーダーでいてほしいし、それを尊重したいけど...もしかしたら無茶して本当の自分を押し殺してるんじゃないかって気がするの。
Every day, she finds a quiet place to write song lyrics without distractions. When she's alone and thinks that nobody is watching her, she might drop the act and revert back to her true self. Can you find her when she's writing song lyrics, and take a picture that shows her true nature?=リーダーは毎日静かな場所で歌詞を書いてるんだ。人目のないとこだと、リーダーも演技をやめて、本当の自分に戻るかも。良かったら、歌詞を書いてるときのリーダーを探して、素顔を写真に撮ってくれない？
Gita Yamahato believes that Miyuji Shan's current personality might be an elaborate act. Wait until Miyuji thinks she is alone, then take a photo of Miyuji that demonstrates her true nature.=Gita YamahatoはMiyuji Shanの今の性格は入念に\n作り上げたものだと思っています。Miyujiが独りになる時間に、Miyujiが本来の性格を見せたところを写真に撮りましょう。
Oh my god! I just realized I asked you to stalk her and take candid pictures of her! Oh, that was a really creepy request, wasn't it?! I'm so sorry I brought it up! Please just forget about it, okay?=よく考えたら、リーダーに付きまとうよう頼んで、写真をとれだなんて、気持ち悪いわよね。ごめんなさい！忘れて！
Thank you! This might be the only way that I'll ever learn the truth!=ありがとう！本当のことを知るには、これしかないの！
Playing air guitar and singing, huh? Well, if she even acts this way when nobody is watching her, then it looks like this really is her true self. Thanks for helping me get to the bottom of this!=エアギターを弾きながら歌ってた？人目のないとこでもそんな感じなら、それが本当のリーダーなのね。助かったわ。ありがとね！

Umejiのタスク
Why are you trying to get all buddy-buddy with me? You think we're gonna be friends, or something?=なんで俺とツルもうとしてんだ？お友達にでもなりたいってか？
It ain't gonna happen. I don't want anything to do with you. Buzz off.=お断りだ。お前とツルむ気はねえ。失せろ。
Ugh...you're still here? Fine...how 'bout this: gimme one hundred dollars. That'll make us the BEST of friends.=うっ、まだ留まる気か？それなら1万円持って来いよ。友達料ってやつだ。
Umeji Kizuguchi is trying to get rid of you, so he told you to bring him $100, because he thinks it's outside of your capability. Show him that he's wrong.=Umeji Kizuguchiはあなたを追い払おうとして、1万円を持ってこいと、無茶な要求をしています。驚かせてやりましょう。
Guess that proves you never wanted to be friends, after all. Now get lost.=お友達になる気はないんだな？なら失せな。
Tch...yeah right, I'll believe it when I see it.=チッ...1万持ってくるまでは信じねえからな。
...seriously? I can't...psh...fine. I'll take it. Just so you know, this doesn't change anything. I'm just accepting a gift, that's all.=...マジで？そんなの受け取れ...よし、頂いておくぞ。一応言っておくが、これで何か変わるわけじゃない。俺はただプレゼントを貰っただけだ。

Hokutoのタスク
Why are you trying to get on my good side? ...oh. I get it. You think that if you're friends with a big bad delinquent, everyone is gonna respect you. Ha...it ain't gonna work.=なぜ俺の舎弟になりたいんだ？...そうか、分かったぞ。超ワルい不良と友達になれば尊敬されると思ったんだろ？ハッ...そううまくはいかないぜ。
Look: you don't wanna hang with us. Blood gets spilled. Bones get cracked. Skulls get split open.=俺らと付き合いたいわけ無いもんな。血は出て、骨は砕け、頭蓋骨は割れる...そんな喧嘩ばかりさ。
Ha...you're not giving up, are you? Okay, here's a job for you: find me...a knife. Something nice, long, and sharp. You think you can handle that? Bet you'd faint at the sight of a blade.=ハッ...諦める気はないんだな？なら仕事をくれてやる。俺にナイフを寄越せ。長くて鋭利な上質のやつをな。できるか？刃を見て失神しねえだろうな？
Hokuto Furukizu has challenged you to bring him a weapon to prove your bravery. He thinks that you are too faint-hearted to carry a knife. Prove him wrong.=Hokuto Furukizuはあなたに度胸試しを挑ん\nでいます。彼はあなたが包丁を持ってこられない臆病者だと思っています。鼻を明かしてやりましょう。
Ha! If a little thing like that scares you, you're definitely not fit to roll with us!=ハッ！この程度で怖気づくようじゃ、俺らの仲間になるには10年早えぞ！
Still trying to act tough, huh? I don't buy it for a second.=大丈夫なフリしてんじゃねえのか？ちょっとやそっとじゃ信じねえからな。
Whoa, where did...hmph. It's good enough. Not exactly what I wanted, but...it'll do. You might be a little tougher than you look, but you haven't changed my mind yet.=うわっ、一体どこから...フフフ、十分だ。俺が欲しかったのとは違うが...まあ及第点ってとこだな。お前は見た目よりタフだが、まだ俺の心は変わってねえからな。

Gakuのタスク(タスク拒否時のセリフは武器所持時の反応に同様のテキストがあるため省略)
I gotchu figured out. Someone's been givin' you a hard time, and you think if you hang out with the scaaary delinquents, nobody will pick on you anymore. I'm right, aren't I?=お前の目的は分かってる。誰かにいじめられて、怖い不良と一緒に居ればいじめられないと思ったんだろ？
Well, your plan ain't gonna work. It'll just turn you into an outcast. You'll be worse off than you could possibly imagine.=無駄だぞ。仲間外れにされるだけだ。想像以上に酷い目に遭うぜ。
If you really think you've got what it takes to join us, I wanna see some proof. I've smelled booze on the headmaster. Sneak into his office, find his secret stash, and bring it back here.=本当に俺らの仲間になりてえなら証明しろ。校長は酒の臭いがする。校長室に忍び込んで酒を盗んで来い。
Gaku Hikitsuri believes that the headmaster has a secret stash of alcohol hidden somewhere in his office. Infiltrate the headmaster's office and retrieve the booze.=Gaku Hikitsuriは校長が酒を校長室に隠し\n持っていると思っています。校長室に忍び込み、酒を手に入れてきましょう。
Seriously? Don't even think of blaming me if something goes wrong.=マジで？失敗しても俺のせいにすんじゃねえぞ。
Did you actually...tch. Not bad, I suppose. Musta been real easy to find. Lemme guess, it was right out in the open, wasn't it? Heh! Well, whatever. I'll take it...but you're not one of us yet.=マジで盗んだのか...チッ、悪くはねえが、簡単に見つかったんだろ？どうせ隠されてもなかったんだろうな。いずれにせよ、まだ俺たちの仲間とは認めねえからな。

Hayanariのタスク
You're one of THOSE types, aren't you? You see a bad boy, and you think you're gonna be the one to 'fix' him, am I right? You think you're gonna turn me into a fine, upstanding citizen, don't ya?=お前もそういうタイプなんだろ？不良と見りゃあ真人間に「矯正」しようとする。俺をまともな人間にしてやろうとでも思ってんだろ？
Well, look: I ain't broken, and you ain't my type. So, whatever fantasy you got in your head, it's not gonna happen. Screw off.=いいか、俺はおかしくなんかねえし、お前は俺のタイプでもねえ。どんな妄想してんのか知らねえが、それは実現しねえ。失せな。
Why are you still here? Damn...you're stubborn as hell. I'll say it again: I don't want you around me. The only thing I want right now is a smoke.=まだ居たのか？頑固な奴だ。もう一度言うが、俺の周りをウロチョロすんじゃねえ。俺が今欲しいのはタバコだけだ。
Hayanari Tsumeato is extremely dismissive of you, but has expressed an interest in smoking cigarettes. Perhaps if you bring him what he wants, he might take you more seriously.=Hayanari Tsumeatoはあなたを全く気に留めて\nいませんが、タバコに興味があるように見えます。彼が欲しがるものを持っていけば、気を引くことができるでしょう。
That's right, walk away.=そうだ、立ち去りやがれ。
What? I wasn't...tch, whatever, do what you like, I don't care.=えっ？そういうわけじゃ...チッ、好きにしろ。俺は知らんからな。
But I don't...huh. Well, at least I know that you're not here to try and 'fix' me. Ah, screw it. As long as you keep bringing me free crap, maybe I'll let you stick around.=えっ？でも僕は...あっ、お前が俺を「矯正」しようとしてるわけじゃねえことはわかった。いいだろう。お前がこれを持ってくる限りは、俺のそばに居るのを認めてやる。

Dairokuのタスク
You gotta be REAL desperate for friends if you're talkin' to me of all people. What's the matter, are you such an outcast that you're scraping the bottom of the barrel at this point?=俺と話してえなんてよっぽどお友達が欲しいようだな。どうした？そんなにハブられて、今更底辺で這いずり回ってんのか？
Listen up...we're from two completely different worlds. You live in the light, and I live in the dark. I ain't sayin' that to sound edgy. That's just the way it is.=よく聞け、俺らは住む世界が違う。お前は光の中で生き、俺は闇の中で生きている。エッジが効いたことを言いたいんじゃねえ。ただの事実だ。
You're the type who studies for tests; I'm the type who just steals the answer sheet. Got it? That's the difference between the two of us. We're not exactly...compatible.=お前はテストのために勉強をするタイプで、俺は模範解答を盗むタイプだ。わかるか？俺らは完全に...相容れない。
Dairoku Surikizu is under the impression that you are too well-behaved to break school rules. To convince him otherwise, you must steal an answer sheet from the faculty room.=Dairoku Surikizuはあなたは学校のルー\nルを破らない、品行方正な生徒だと思い込んでいます。答案用紙を職員室から盗み、彼の間違いを正してやりましょう。
That's right. Go beg somebody else to be your friend.=そうだ。別の奴に友達になってもらえ。
Ha...you got something planned? Gonna try to prove me wrong? Yeah...I'm not holdin' my breath.=は？何が目的だ？俺が間違ってるとでも言いたいのか？まあ...期待はしてねえからな。
Wow, you just...huh...I hate to admit it, but maybe I was wrong about you. I thought your hands were clean, but...maybe we're cut from the same cloth, after all. We're not friends yet, though.=ほう...認めたくねえが、俺はお前を誤解してたらしい。お前の手は綺麗だと思っていたが、案外同じ穴の貉かもな。だが、まだ仲間とは認めてねえぞ。

musumeのタスク
I am SO sick of Horuda Puresu...she's such a freak! She's even worse than those creeps from the Occult Club! At my old school, we would have given her the "Brown Paint Treatment."=Horuda Puresuってヤツ、マジでキモくない！？オカルト部のキモオタどもよりもキツいんだよね！前の学校だったら、あーゆーヤツには茶色いペンキでお仕置きしてたんだけどなー。
Oh, you don't know what that is? You pour brown paint into a bucket, put it above a doorway, and get an unsuspecting victim to walk through the door. Then...SPLASH! She gets what's been coming to her!=茶色いペンキをバケツに入れて、ドアの上において、ウザいヤツが通るのを待つの。そしたら...バシャー！ってね。ジゴージトクってヤツ！
And then, to take it a step further, you take a photo of the victim covered in brown sludge and plaster it all over social media! The shame lasts for WEEKS! Oh, Horuda deserves it sooooo badly...=そしたら近寄って、ペンキまみれの写真を撮って、拡散してやんの！ずーーーっと笑いモンよ。あーあ、Horudaもそーゆー目に遭わせたいなー。
Musume Ronshaku wants to see Horuda Puresu covered in brown paint. Fill a bucket with water, add brown paint to it, put the bucket over a doorway, and get Horuda to walk through the doorway. You can find brown paint in the Art Club.=Musume Ronshakuは、Horuda Puresuが茶色いペンキまみれの姿を見たいようです。バケツを水で満たし、茶色い塗料を加え、バケツをドアの上に設置し、Horudaがそのドアを通るように仕向けましょう。茶色い塗料は芸術部室にあります。
Oh, look at little miss goody-two-shoes over here. Think you're better than the rest of us, huh? Tch...buzzkill.=あっそ、良い子ちゃんが偉そーにしやがって。チッ...空気読めよ。
Oh my gosh - are you serious?! You're gonna do it?! Ohoho, this is gonna be GOOD! If you actually bring me a photo of Horuda looking like she's covered in sewer sludge, I would love you for-EVER!=おー、マジでやんの！？いいね！最ッ高！Horudaがきったない水で汚れてる写真を持ってきてくれたら、一生愛してやんよ！
HAHAHAHAHA! Look at her! She looks like a rat that just crawled out of the sewer! Now her appearance matches her personality! HAHAHA...oh, god...you are such a girlboss for this! Thanks, bestie!=ハハハハハ！見てよ！ドブから出てきたネズミみたい！陰キャ女にはお似合いだね！ハハハハ...いやー...あんた結構やるじゃん！あんがと！
Ugh, like ohhhhh my GAWD, have you seen Horuda Puresu? She's so creepy! Even worse than those Occult Club freaks.=ねえねえ、Horuda Puresuってヤツ知ってるぅ？アイツめっちゃキモいよね！オカルト部のヤツよりヤバイ！
Whenever she's not in class, she like, runs off and hides somewhere! What the hell is she up to? I bet she's got a dirty little secret!=授業が終わるとすぐどっか行っちゃうし、何やってんだろ？絶対なんか隠してるっしょ！
If you can find her  hiding spot and snap a photo of what she's up to, I'd so totally be your best friend forever!=もしアイツの隠れてるとこを見つけて、何してんのか撮影したら、あんたと友達になってあげてもいいよ！
Musume Ronshaku thinks Horuda Puresu is hiding a dirty secret. Find out where Horuda spends her time, and take a photo of what she does there.=Musume Ronshakuは、Horuda Puresuが知られたく\nない秘密を持っていると思っています。彼女が独りで過ごしているところを見つけて写真を撮ってきましょう。
Awwwww, look at this little miss goody-two-shoes over here! Heh...think you're better than me? Ha, what-everrrrr!=はあぁぁぁ？何？いい子ぶっちゃってさ！アタシのことナメてんの？話になんねー！
Hurry up so I can spill the tea, gurl!=早くしないとあんたの噂流すかんね！
...seriously? She just...reads books? That's it? ...no way. That can't be the end of it! There's gotta be something else going on here. Thanks for your help, though - now I know where to find her!=...マジ？ただ本読んでただけ？いやいや、それはないっしょ！絶対他に秘密があるって...まあ居場所わかったしいっか。手伝ってくれてあんがと。
There's gotta be something else going on here. Thanks for your help, though - now I know where to find her!=絶対他に秘密があるって...まあ居場所わかったしいっか。手伝ってくれてあんがと。



Kaguya
There are some girls who I really want to be friends with...but they're a very tight-knight group, and they're kind of picky about who's allowed to join their friend circle.=友だちになりたいなーって子がいるんだけど、その子のグループに入るのが難しくて...メンバーに気に入られなきゃ仲間に入れてくれないらしいの。
There are some girls who I really want to be friends with...but they're a very tight-knit group, and they're kind of picky about who's allowed to join their friend circle.=友だちになりたいなーって子がいるんだけど、その子のグループに入るのが難しくて...メンバーに気に入られなきゃ仲間に入れてくれないらしいの。
I noticed that they all wear socks that match their hair color. It's so cute! I've been thinking... maybe if I also wear socks that match my hair...they'll start to see me as part of their group!=でね、そのグループの子たちはみんな髪色に合ったソックスを履いてるって気づいたの！可愛いよね！それで、私も髪色に合ったソックスを履けばグループに入れるかなって！
Haha, I know, I know...I probably sound silly right now. I know that socks don't magically turn people into your friends. But, with THESE girls...I think it would actually make a difference!=ハハハ、変なこと言ってるのはわかってるのよ。ソックスは友達を増やす魔法の道具なんかじゃないもの。でもあの子たちになら効果的だと思うわ！
Kaguya Wakaizumi wants a pair of pink socks so she can fit in with the girls that she wants to be friends with. Go to the Sewing Room, grab some cloth, and use a sewing machine to make a pair of pink socks for her.=Kaguya Wakaizumiはピンクのソックスを履くこ\nとで気になる女子と友達になれると考えているようです。裁縫室に行き、布をもらい、ミシンでピンクのソックスを作ってあげましょう。
...yeah...you're right...if I look like I'm trying way too hard to be friends with them, it'll probably just make me look like a loser. Maybe I shouldn't try to wear matching socks, after all...=...そうよね...あなたが正しいと思う...友達になろうと必死になってたら、なんだか勝負に負けたみたいな感じがするもんね。ソックスを変えるのはやめたほうがいいのかな...
Really?! You'll sew me a pair of pink socks?! I would absolutely love that!=本当に！？ピンクのソックスを編んでくれるの！？とっても嬉しいわ！
Whoa! You actually did it! These socks are just what I wanted! Now I can finally fit in with the other girls! Thank you so much!=わあ！編んでくれたのね！こういうのが欲しかったの！これであの子たちとお揃いだわ！本当にありがとうね！
Moeko
There's a group of boys I'm trying to make friends with, but they don't seem comfortable around me. If you manage to make friends with one of them, come talk to me - I'd love to ask you for a favor..=友達になりたい男子がいるんだけど、みんなよそよそしいんだよな。もしアンタがその中の1人と友達になったら、頼めることがあるかなって思うんだ。
Hey! You made friends with a guy! I've been trying to do the same thing, but...boys never wanna be friends with me. They only see me as a girl. Argh, I just want to be "one of the guys," you know?!=おお！あの男子と友達になったんだな！アタシもそうしたいんだけど、実は、誰もアタシを「女の子」としか見てくれないんだ。そう、アタシは「男子の一員」として見て欲しいんだ！
In order to make friends with them, I think I need to know more about their interests; their likes and dislikes. Since you already made friends with one of them...maybe you can help me out with this.=だったら、まずは男子の趣味を知るのがいいんじゃないかって思ってるんだ。もうアイツとは仲良いんだろ？そしたらちょっと頼めないかな…
Talk to the guy you made friends with, ask him to follow you, and take him to every club in school. He'll give you his opinions on each club. Then, come back and tell me what you learned about him!=友達になった子を連れて色んな部室を回れば、その部活をどう思ってるか聞けるだろ？それをやって、分かったことをアタシに教えて欲しいんだ。
Moeko Rakuyona wants to know more about any one of the "Rainbow Boys" so that she can make friends with them. Ask one of them to follow you, and then lead him into various clubrooms around school to learn his likes and dislikes.=Moeko Rakuyonaは「Rainbow Boys」のうち1人のこ\nとを詳しく知れば、彼らと親しくなるきっかけになると考えています。誰か1人を連れて部室を回ることで、その人の興味を知ることができます。
...oh. I guess I didn't realize how...desperate I sounded. Yikes. Maybe THAT'S the reason why they don't want to be friends with me. Sigh...I guess I'd better re-think my priorities...=えっ…そうか、アタシは必死になりすぎてるのか…うう…もしかして、そのせいで引かれてるとか…はあ…やり方を考え直した方がいいのかな…
Please, don't let me down - you're my only hope!=サンキュー！ほんっっと、頼むよ！
So, these are the things he likes, and the thinks he doesn't like?! Sweet! Now I finally know everything I need in order to fit in and finally become "one of the guys!" Thank you so much!=ああ、それがアイツの好みなんだな。やった！これで「男子の一員」になれる！ありがとな！！
So, these are the things he likes, and the things he doesn't like?! Sweet! Now I finally know everything I need in order to fit in and finally become "one of the guys!" Thank you so much!=ああ、それがアイツの好みなんだな。やった！これで「男子の一員」になれる！ありがとな！！
Honami
...well...there is...something I want help with...but...I wouldn't want to bother you...unless you love books as much as I do...uh...in other words...you would need to...raise your "Language Stat"...=あの…えっと…困ってはいるんだけど…もっと…本が好きな人…じゃないと…迷惑かなって…あっ…つまり…「国語」に強い人だったら…あなたが…

Sumiko
Well, actually, there is something that I'd love to ask for help with! But, ah...I could only ask someone athletic for help with this one. You'd need to...raise your "Physical Stat," so to speak.=いや～、頼みたいことはあるんだけどね、運動が出来る人に頼みたいと思ってるのよ。君がもっと「体育」が得意になったらまた来て欲しいな。
Alright, so, here's the story: There's this absolutely adorable stray cat living on school grounds, and I really wish I could pet him...but, the problem is, he runs away whenever I approach him.=学校の敷地内にとっても可愛い猫が住んでて、ペットにしたいなと思ってたんだけど...近づこうとするの逃げられるんだよ。
I've tried to catch him, but he outruns me every time...and I'm supposed to be an athlete! Do you realize how much that hurts my pride?! At this point, petting that cat has become my life's goal!=捕まえようと思って追いかけても全然追いつかなくてさ。アスリートとしてのプライドがめっちゃ傷ついたよ！こうなったら、何が何でもあの猫を撫でてみたいんだ！
If you could catch that stray cat and bring him to me...oh, man, I would be your best friend forever!=もしあの猫を連れてきてくれたら、親友になってあげるから！
Sumiko Tachibana wants to pet a certain cat so that she can feel better about not being fast enough to catch it. Find the cat behind the statue of the headmaster, chase it down, grab it, and bring it back to her.=Sumiko Tachibanaは、ある猫を捕まえて、その\n猫に走る速さで負けた悔しさを晴らそうとしています。校長像の後ろにいるその猫を追いかけて、捕まえて、彼女に見せましょう。
...oh, man. Ha! I did NOT realize how weird that was going to sound until I said it out loud. "Go catch a cat for me!" Geez, what was I thinking? Please, just forget this conversation ever happened.=あー、よくよく考えたら変な頼み事だったな。「私のために猫ちゃんを捕まえてきてー！」だなんて、何考えてるんだ私は。このことは忘れてね。
You'll try to catch him for me?! Awesome! The last time I saw him, he was behind the statue of the headmaster. His fur is black, so he should be easy to spot. Good luck catching him...you'll need it!=猫を連れてきてくれるの！？やったあ！あの猫を最後に見たのは校長像の後ろだったよ。黒いし見つけやすいと思うよ。頑張ってね！
Oh! Wow! You actually did it! You caught him! Oh, man, he's even more cute up close! C'mere, little guy! Who's a kitty? Who's a cute little kitty cat? You are! You are!=わあ！連れてきてくれたんだ！間近で見るととってもかわいい！よしよーし、お前はなんでそんなに可愛いんだ～？
Ritsuko
...hmm? And what, pray tell, do YOU want? Ugh...please, don't speak to me - in fact, don't even breathe the same air as me - until you can bring at least $500 to school without batting an eye.=え？それで一体何なんですの？はぁ…あなたのような貧乏人とは同じ空気だって吸いたくないですわ。少なくとも5万円は当たり前に学校に持ってこられるんじゃないなら、私と口をきかないでくださいな。
Ugh! How many times do I have to say it? I have absolutely no interest in associating with anyone who is not as...wait. Is that...money I smell?=はぁ…何度言えば分かりますの？貧乏人はあっちへ…あら？お金の匂いが…
*Sniff, sniff*...oh, my goodness! Unless my nose deceives me...you're carrying at least $500 with you! But...how can I really know that you're affluent enough to be worthy of my precious time?=クンクン…あ～ら、良かったですわね！あなた、5万円くらいは持っていらっしゃいますのね！でも、まだ仲良くしてあげると決めたわけではありませんわ！
I hereby propose a challenge: Give me $1,000. Yes, that's right...hand it over. If you truly are rich, then parting with that sum of money will be of no consequence to you. Well, what do you say?=私とお話がしたいのなら…10万円、持ってきて、私に差し出しなさい。もしお金持ちでしたら、そんなはした金、手放すのに何も感じないでしょう？ほら、どうなさいますの？
Ritsuko Chikanari is incapable of respecting anyone who lacks an abundance of wealth. In order to earn her respect, you must  project the appearance of an extremely wealthy young woman by giving her $1,000.=Ritsuko Chikanariは、お金を持っている人間に\nしか興味がありません。彼女と友達になるために、10万円を渡し、自分は金持ちだと証明しましょう。
Ha. I knew that you were merely pretending to be rich. Now, begone, peasant.=ふん！やっぱり見かけだけでしたわね。シッシッ！
Oh? You accept? Very well, then! In that case, I shall wait with bated breath for you to accrue and deliver the henceforth agreed-upon sum of money, in cash. Toodle-loo! ...and don't keep me waiting.=ほ～ぅ、言いましたわね。ならば私は、ここにお金が積まれるのを心待ちにしておりますわ。ではごきげんよう。…あまり私を待たせないことですわ。
Ah! Money! For me? Give it here! Ha ha ha ha ha! MONEY! ...friends? Yes, yes, we're friends now, and whatnot. ...now then, back to more important matters. Ahem...MONEY!=おぉ！現金！これを私に？早く渡しなさい！お～っほっほっほ！金ですわ！え？はい、はい、今から私たちはお友達ですわ。ええ。さて…そんなことより…ああ、お金、お金…
Ai
Now that you mention it, there IS something that I need help with! ...but, specifically, I need help from someone who loves music as much as I do. Maybe if you were a member of the Light Music Club...=言われれば、頼み事はあるかな！でも、私とおなじように音楽が好きな人にぜひ手伝って欲しいの！う～ん…軽音部の人に頼もうかな…
Oh, hey! I need your help! I want to compose a new song, but I'm having trouble coming up with a good melody. That's where you come in! Would you please compose a melody for me? Please, be my hero!=あ、ちょっと！助けて欲しいの！新曲を考えてるんだけど、いいメロディが思い浮かばないの…それで、あなたに頼みたいことがあるの！何かメロディを作ってみてくれないかな？一生のお願い！
Apparently, there's a piano somewhere in school...it's inside of a storage room, or something like that. Also, there's a tape recorder in the Computer Lab. Do you get what I'm saying? Hm? Hmmmmm...?=えっと、ピアノが学校の倉庫かどこかにあったよね…それと、パソコン室にテープレコーダーがあったよね…言ってること分かる？ん？んむむむ…？

Ai Doruyashi wants someone to compose a melody for her so that she can get started producing her next song. Go to the Computer Lab, grab the tape recorder, bring it to the piano located in one of the school's storage rooms, play a melody on the piano, then bring the tape recorder back to her.=Ai Doruyashiは、次の曲の制作のために、何か\nメロディを作って欲しいと言っています。パソコン室にあるテープレコーダーを学校の倉庫にあるピアノのところに持っていき、ピアノでメロディを奏で、レコーダーを彼女に渡しましょう。
Awwwww maaaaan! I really thought that you were gonna be my hero! I even said gogogogogogo! How can you say no to someone after they've said gogogogogogo for you? C'mon, please, c'mon, c'mon, please?=えぇーーーっっ！ホントに、一生のお願いだってば！これから先、Aiちゃんに声をかけてもらえるなんて無いかもよ？これからずっと後悔しちゃうかもだよ？！だから、ねえ、ホントに、本っっ当に、お願い！
Yay! You can do it! I believe in you!=ありがと！あなたならできるから！期待してるから！
Doo, do-do-do-doot, do-do-doot, do doo...this melody is perfect! Amazing! Beautiful! Legendary! Ten outta ten, ten outta ten! Hundred outta hundred! Best song, best song! Thank you sooooo much!=ル～ルルルル～ルルル～ルル～…これ、完っ璧だね！最高！天才！10点満点！100点満点！めっっっちゃいい曲になるよ！！ホントに、ホントにありがとう！！！！
Teiko
There IS something I need help with, but I could only trust an academic prodigy with the task. In a manner of speaking, you'd need to "fully max out a school subject" before I could ask for your help.=はい、頼みたいことならあります。でも、学力が極めて高い人じゃないと任せられないのです。言い換えると、「1つの教科を完璧にこなせる」なら大丈夫でしょう。
I am assisting the teachers in composing their lesson plans. I've identified which books from Akademi's library would be most useful for helping the teachers with their upcoming lessons.=私は先生がたの授業計画作成のお手伝いをしています。それで図書室の蔵書から、今後の授業に特に役立つと考えられる6冊の本を選びました。
To make a long story short, I'll summarize the situation thusly: there are six books that need to be carried from the school Library to the school's six classrooms and placed on the teachers' podiums.=今の状況を端的に言うと、図書室から6冊の本を各教室に運び、教卓に置きに行く必要があります。
I can provide you with the names of those books. If you would be willing to travel to the library, collect the books, and bring them to the teachers' podiums, I would be very grateful to you!=私がその本の名前を教えますので、あなたは図書室に行ってそれらを持ち出し、教卓に置いてきてくだされば大変助かります。やっていただけますか？
Teiko Nabatasai wants six books from the school library to be delivered to various podiums throughout school. Go to the library, grab some books from a bookshelf, and place one book on each of the podiums of the school's six classrooms.=Teiko Nabatasaiは、6冊の本を図書室から教卓\nに持っていこうとしています。図書室へ行き、本棚から本を持ち出し、各教室の教卓に置きましょう。
I see. I shouldn't have bothered you with my request. In retrospect, I suppose it was quite silly of me to assume that I'd find an idle pair of hands in one of the most elite schools on the planet!=分かりました。あなたの手を煩わせるつもりはありませんでした。そもそも、世界トップレベルの学校で暇な人を探すなんてことが間違いでしたね。
Oh, it's ever so gracious of you to offer to help me! Here is the list of books that need to be transported. Thanks in advance for your help!=ああ、ありがとうございます。運ぶ本のリストはこれです。よろしくお願いいたします。
You've delivered the books to the podiums? Well done! I appreciate your assistance very much!=すべての本を運び終わりましたか？これで仕事は終わりです。手伝ってくださりありがとうございました。
Komako
Well, now that I think about it...there actually is a request that I would like to make, but I would only be able to ask such a favor of someone who has befriended at least 10 people at this school.=その…お気持ちは嬉しいのですが、私が悩んでいることは、ご友人が10人はいる方でないとお願いできないものなんです。
I am terribly sorry if it disappoints you to hear this, but, to be honest, there is nothing that I would like to ask for help with. There are no favors you can do for me. However, with that said...=本当に申し訳ないのですが、正直に言うと、私があなたにして欲しいと思うことはなにもありません。ですが…
If your goal is to somehow prove yourself to me, I can tell you what would earn you my respect. I would like to see you go forth and make as many people happy as humanly possible.=あなたが私に好かれたいということであれば、あなたが私にとって尊敬できる人になればいいのです。私は、あなたがたくさんの人を幸せにするのを見てみたいです。
In other words...talk to the other students at school, find out what is troubling them, and solve their respective problems. If you could do this for twenty students, then I would truly respect you.=つまり…学校のみなさんと話して、悩みごとを聞いて、解決してあげる…そうやって20人も幸せにできるのであれば、あなたを心から尊敬します。
Komako Funakoshi desires nothing except the happiness of others. In order to gain her respect, you must travel around school and perform favors and tasks for other students until you have befriended 20 students in total.=Komako Funakoshiは、他人の幸せ以外は何も望\nんでいません。彼女に信頼されるために、校内をまわり、少なくとも全部で20人と友達になるまで頼み事を聞いて、解決してまわりましょう。
I am not surprised to hear you say that. It is quite rare to find someone who is willing to dedicate themself to the pursuit of bringing happiness to others...=そう言われるのも無理はありません…誰かの幸せのために自分を犠牲にできるという人は本当に少ないですから…
Oh? You are thinking of this as a "Task" to complete? My, my - I certainly did not expect you to interpret my words that way. Well, as long as you bring happiness to others, I suppose it's fine.=あら？それが「課題」だとおっしゃるのですか？そ、そう受け取られることは考えておりませんでした…いえ、あなたの献身を見せてくれたらそれでいいのです。
I have been seeing so many smiling faces at school lately - and they are all saying that you are the cause of their joy! I truly respect you for devoting your time to spreading cheer throughout school!=今、この学校には笑顔があふれています。みんなあなたのおかげだと言っています。私はみんなのために尽くすあなたを心から尊敬いたします。
Chigusa
There IS something that I'd like to have help with, but...I would only be able to ask for assistance from a girl who...well...let's just say that she would need to have a higher..."Seduction Stat."=手伝って欲しいことはあるよ。だけど…うん…もっと「魅力」のあるコがいいかなぁ…
Hey! Has anyone ever told you that you should be a model?! I'm not just saying that to be nice; I actually mean it. You've got what it takes to go pro, girl. I want you to join me for a photo shoot!=ねえ！アナタ、モデルさんみたいって言われたことない？お世辞じゃなくて、ホントにさ！プロにもなれるとおもうんだよね。撮影に参加しない？
Yes! I'm serious! I mean it! Gravure photo shoots with multiple girls always sell like hot cakes. Trust me; this could launch an entire career for you, girl!=もちろんホンキだよ！何人かで撮ったグラビア写真は結構売れるんだー。信じて、これはアナタのグラドル人生の始まりになるから！
If you're not free right now, that's fine - but, for future reference, anytime you ever see me at the school pool, slip into a swimsuit and join me! We'll do a photo shoot together! It'll be fun!=今すぐはムリだけど、私がプールで撮影してる間に水着で来てね！そしたら一緒に撮影しましょ！きっと楽しいよ！
Chigusa Busujima wants to perform a "duo" gravure photo shoot to advance her career faster. Whenever Chigusa is at the school pool being photographed by other students, go to the locker room, change into a swimsuit, join her at the pool, and participate in a gravure photo shoot with her.=Chigusa Busujimaは、早く有名になるためにグ\nラビアのツーショットを撮ろうと思っています。Chigusaがプールで撮影をしているところに、水着に着替えて参加して写真に入りましょう。
Awwwww, c'mon...you're missing out on the opportunity of a lifetime here!=ちょっとー、またとないチャンスをふいにしちゃうの！？
Yes! I can't wait! We're going to take the gravure world by storm, girl!=やったぁ！楽しみね！一緒にグラビア界を荒らしてやりましょ！
See? I knew you could do it! After a stellar photo shoot like that, I'm 100% certain that you're going to get scouted and become Japan's next top model! Let's do this again sometime, girlfriend!=ね、できたでしょ？こんなにいい写真が撮れたんだし、ぜっっったいスカウトが来て、いつか日本のトップモデルになれるわ！また今度、一緒にやりましょうね！
You've got a killer figure, girl! You should join me for a photo shoot! All you'd need is a bikini! Oh, don't have one? Hmm...I wonder if the sewing room has the appropriate fabric for a swimsuit...=アナタ、いいカラダしてるよね…ワタシの写真撮影に一緒に来てみない？ビキニは持ってる？え？持ってないって？うーん、裁縫室にビキニを作るのに使える布があったかも…
Whoa! You look stunning in that bikini! Has anyone ever told you that you should be a model?! I'm not just saying that to be nice; I actually mean it! You've got what it takes to go pro, girl!=いいね！魅力的だね！アナタ、モデルさんみたいって言われたことない？お世辞じゃなくて、ホントにさ！プロにもなれるとおもうんだよね。
I want you to join me for a photo shoot! I'm serious! I mean it! Gravure photo shoots with multiple girls always sell like hot cakes. Trust me; this could launch an entire career for you, girl!=一緒に撮影に参加しない？もちろんホンキだよ！こういうコラボ写真は結構売れるんだ～。信じて、これはアナタのグラドル人生の始まりになるから！
If you're not free right now, that's fine - but, for future reference, anytime you ever see me at the school pool, you are more than welcome to join me! C'mon, girl - it'll be super fun, I promise!=今ムリなら仕方ないけど、その気があるなら、ワタシがプールで撮影してる時に来てね！絶対楽しいよ！間違いなし！
Sonoko
What's that? You...want to know if I have a "Task" for you? ...Hmm. Interesting. Okay, sure...I'll take the bait. Here's a "Task" for you: Bring me a Faculty ID card. Do that, and THEN we'll talk.=はい？「頼み事」はないかって？ふむ、面白いですね。乗ってあげましょう。では「頼み事」を伝えます。Akademiの教員証を持ってきてください。話はそれからです。
What? Is that a...faculty ID card you're carrying? Well, well, well...looks like we have a little kleptomaniac on our hands...=え？それは...教員証ですか？ふむふむ...どうやらあなたは手癖も悪いみたいですね。
If you're up for it, I have a challenge for you. Steal the katana in the Headmaster's office and bring it to me. Ah, but that's not all - I want you to do it BEFORE the clock strikes 8:00 AM.=やる気があるのなら、試してあげましょう。校長室から刀を盗んで持ってきてください。せっかくですし、午前8時より早い時間に、という条件も課しましょう。
Oh, and you'd better put it into a container of some sort before you bring it to me. An instrument case, a trash can - something along those lines. Do NOT run up to me holding a weapon in your hands.=それと、武器をそのまま持ち歩くのはおすすめしません。楽器ケースやゴミ箱などに入れて持ってきてください。武器を手に持ったまま近寄るのは絶対にやめてください。
Sonoko Sakanoue has a challenge for you. She wants you to bring her a katana from the Headmaster's office before 8:00 AM. Make the Headmaster leave his office, grab the key to the katana case, open the case, grab the katana, and bring it to Sonoko (with the katana inside a container, of course).=Sonoko Sakanoueはあなたを試しています。校\n長室にある日本刀を、午前8:00までに持っていきましょう。校長を移動させ、鍵を探して刀を持ちだし、彼女に見せましょう。刀は忘れずに何か入れ物に隠してください。
Heh...let me know if you change your mind.=ほう...気が変わったら言ってくださいね。
Ha! Good luck...you'll need it.=ほう！幸運を祈ります...ま、無理でしょうけどね。
...wait, what?! Is that...the katana?! No way...you actually did it! But, how...? Tch...whatever. A deal's a deal. You completed my challenge...so I'll perform a "Favor" for you. Better make it count.=な、なんですって！？それは...刀！？バカな...やり遂げたんですか！どうやって...？チッ、いずれにせよ取引は取引です。私の試験を突破したのですから、あなたの「お願い」も一つ聞いてあげましょう。何を頼むか、よく考えておきなさい。

togo atatsumaのタスク(1980sの不良)
...what are you talkin' to me for? Tch...trust me, I'm not the type of guy you want to get involved with. If you spend too much time around me...you're gonna get hurt.=...何の用だ？チッ...俺のようなヤツには関わらねえほうがいい。俺の周りをうろついてると、痛い目見るぜ。
...I'm not just saying that, you know. I'm serious. I pissed off some pretty nasty guys...and every day, they wait outside the school gate for me to show up so they can beat me senseless.=...冗談じゃねえ。本気だ。俺は厄介なヤツらに目を付けられちまった...毎日校門の外に張り込んでやがる...俺をボコるためにな。
If they see me and you together...they'll think you're my girl. And if they get the impression that you're important to me, they'll probably try to rough you up...or worse. So just stay away from me. Got it?=もし俺とお前が一緒に居るのを見られたら...お前は俺の女だと思われちまう。そうなれば、あいつらはお前に乱暴...いや、それ以上のことをするかもしれない。だから俺に近づくのはやめろ。いいな？
Togo Atatsuma is being antagonized by a local gang. Talk to him outside of the school gates after 3:30 PM to defeat his enemies in a brawl.=Togo Atatsumaは地元の暴力団に目を付けら\nれています。午後3:30以降に彼に話しかけて組員を乱闘でブチのめしましょう。
...heh. You're smarter than you look.=フッ...案外賢明じゃねえか。
...heh, what? Are you insane? You think you could take them on?! We're talking about a gang, here! You wouldn't stand a chance! Tch...your funeral. I'll be waiting at the school gate at 3:30 PM.=はぁ？正気か？ヤツらを相手にするってのか！？ヤクザだぞ！？勝てる訳がない！チッ...死んでも知らんぞ。3:30以降に校門前で待ってるからな。
Yep...there they are. Right on schedule. You better leave, before - =おっと...来たな。予定通りだ。お前は安全なうちに帰...
...hey! You're not actually gonna try to fight them, are ya?! They'll kick your ass!=...待て！ガチで戦うつもりなのか！？ケツを蹴とばされるだけだぞ！
...(sigh)...no turning back now. ...Here they come!=...はぁ...もう後戻りはできねえからな。行くぞ！
Rival Gang Member #1=ヤクザの組員 #1
Rival Gang Member #2=ヤクザの組員 #2
Rival Gang Member #3=ヤクザの組員 #3
Rival Gang Member #4=ヤクザの組員 #4
Rival Gang Member #5=ヤクザの組員 #5
...I've...I've never seen anything like that before! You're...not human...=こ、こんな強えヤツ初めて見たぜ！お前...本当に人間か？
...heh...after today, I definitely won't have to worry about those guys anymore...=ヘっ...これでもうヤツらに悩まされることもないんだな...
If you hadn't stepped in, though...they probably would have killed me! I...heh...I owe ya my life!=お前が来てくれなきゃ最悪殺されてたかもしれねえ！お前は...俺の命の恩人だ！
There's no way I could ever pay you back for what you just did. But...there's someone else who might be able to.=俺にはこの恩に報いる力がねえ。だが...代わりに恩を返せそうな人を知ってる。
...my brother. He's got...connections.=...兄さんだ。兄さんにはそっちのスジにコネがあってな。
You know the street with all the stores? At night, you can find my brother there, in an alleyway.=商店街を知ってるな？夜にそこの路地に入れば兄さんがいる。
I'll tell him to hook you up with whatever you want. After that, we'll be square. All right?=欲しいもんは何でも用意するよう頼んでおく。これで借りはチャラだ。いいな？
And, hey...thanks again.=それから、その...ありがとな。


コピペ元出力
科学部MiyukiEV
Okay...explain it to me one more time?=じゃあ、もう一度説明してくれ。
So, there are these invisible monsters that feed off of negative emotions. If these monsters grow powerful enough, they can influence human behavior, which results in crimes like murder.=だから、悪い感情を食らう目に見えない怪物がいて、怪物たちが強大になってくると、人間の行動に影響を与えて、殺人とか犯罪を引き起こすんだ。
There's a small number of people who have the ability to see and fight the monsters. Only females can have this power. The show is about the magical girls who can see and fight the monsters.=怪物を見て戦うことができる人は少ない。女の子だけがそういう力を持っている。この番組は怪物を見て戦うことができる魔法少女たちの物語だ。
Their power depends on how many admirers they have, so the magical girls are usually pop idols. All of them are actresses, singers, models, super-popular bloggers, and things like that.=魔法少女たちの力はファンの数に依存しているから、魔法少女は人気アイドルをしてることが多い。俳優だったり、歌手だったり、モデルだったり、超人気ブロガーだったりする。
Their power gets weaker when they're far away from their fans, so the Japanese magical girls stay in Japan, the American magical girls stay in America, and so on. Are you getting all of this?=ファンから遠ざかれば弱くなるから、日本の魔法少女は日本で、アメリカの魔法少女はアメリカにいるもんなんだ。ここまではOK？
If they stopped being popular, then they would lose their power - so they have to juggle their public celebrity life with their secret magical girl life. That's where it gets interesting.=仮に人気がなくなることがあろうものなら、力を失ってしまう。だから有名人としての活動も魔法少女としての活動も何とかやりくりしてこなさなきゃいけないんだ。そこが面白いところだね。
The protagonist is a girl named Miyuki who isn't a celebrity, she's just the most popular girl in her school. The other magical girls look down on her because she's nothing like them.=主人公はMiyukiという女の子なんだけど、有名人というわけじゃなくて、学校で人気のある子なんだ。他の魔法少女たちは自分たちとは違うからってことでMiyukiを見下してる。
The show is about Miyuki's struggle to cut it as a magical girl even though she's relatively weak, and none of the other magical girls respect her. Trust me, man, this show is freaking amazing.=Miyukiが他の子よりも弱くて馬鹿にされていても、なお奮闘して道を切り開こうとする物語なんだ。信じてくれよな。本当に気が狂うほど面白いんだから。
I don't want to spoil it, but it gets REALLY GOOD once Miyuki starts getting stronger than some of the veteran magical girls, and they start...ah...just trust me, you NEED to watch this show.=ネタバレしたいわけじゃないけど、でもMiyukiが古参の魔法少女よりも強くなり始める頃がめっっっっちゃいいんだよ。そして彼女たちが...ああもう、とにかく信じてくれ。ぜっっったいに番組を見なきゃ。
I dunno, dude. It doesn't sound like my type of show.=知らんよ。俺の好みじゃなさそうだな。
One of the main characters is a swimsuit model who has millions of fans because she's super busty.=メインキャラの一人は超巨乳で何百万ものファンがいる水着モデルだよ。
Hahaha...okay, I might give it a look. What's it called, again?=ハハハ、分かったよ。ちょっと見てみるかもしれん。なんて番組だっけ？
Magical Girl Pretty Miyuki!=魔法少女プリティみゆき！
You don't need to strike a pose when you tell me, dude.=そのポーズはいるのか、なあ。
If you saw the show, you'd understand!=番組を見てれば、分かるだろうになあ。
科学部MiyukiEV
I watched the first episode, and...I don't...see what's so great about it.=第1話を見たけど...何がいいのか...分からなかったな。
Dude, you NEED to keep watching. It gets REALLY good about halfway through the first season.=だから、そのまま見続けろって。第1期の途中あたりからほんっっっとによくなるんだから。
That's lame, dude! I don't want to watch something that sucks for the first half!=それダメなやつじゃねーか。つまらんものを半期も見たくはないな。
No, you don't get it! The first half of the show is there to TRICK people into THINKING that they're watching a typical magical girl show, and then, BAM, the plot twists start dropping!=いやそうじゃないって。前半は視聴者を典型的な魔法少女番組だと思い込ませるところなんだ。それでバァン！とどんでん返しが始まる。
Dude, did you just spoil something that was supposed to be a surprise?=お前のせいで驚くように作ってあるシナリオが台無しになったんじゃないか？
Yyyyyes, technically, BUT! If you were planning to drop the show, then it was totally worth it! You need to understand this: Magical Girl Pretty Miyuki is a DECONSTRUCTION of magical girl shows!=まあ厳密に言えばな。だけど！ 番組を切るつもりでいたなら、ネタバレしたって全然いいだろ。とにかく理解してくれ。魔法少女プリティみゆきは魔法少女の脱構築なんだよ！
Everything is called a "deconstruction" these days. What does that even mean?=最近は何でも脱構築っていうけどな、実際どういうことなんだよ？
It takes the concept of magical girls, and then applies it to real life. Like, how hard would your life actually be if you really were a magical girl? That's what the show is about!=魔法少女の概念を、実際の生活に適用したところかな。仮に魔法少女なんてものになれたとしたら、生活がどれだけきつくなるかっていう物語さ。
I'm pretty sure this isn't the first time there's been a show like that.=そういう番組みるのは初めてじゃないけどな。
Yeah, but, Miyuki does it differently! Trust me, dude - truuuuust me! Keep watching. You NEED to!=まあな、だけどプリティみゆきは違うんだって！信じてくれよ！とにかく観続けてくれ！
Yeah, but, Miyuki does it differently! Trust me, dude - truuuuust me! keep watching. You NEED to!=まあな、だけどプリティみゆきは違うんだって。信じてくれよ、とにかくさ。見続けてくれ。見続ける必要があるんだ。
科学部MiyukiEV
Have you been watching it?=番組は見続けてるか？
Yeah, I watched a few more episodes. Still really cliche. Still a whole bunch of boring old tropes.=まあ、何話か見たけども、やっぱりただのクリシェだな。つまらん古くさいよくある展開ばっかりだ。
That's what makes it so good! It lays out all these tropes, and then it SUBVERTS the tropes!=そこがいいんだよ！ よくあるパターンを展開してからひっくり返すのさ！
I feel like you're spoiling it for me when you say stuff like that.=お前がそういうとネタバレで台無しになっている気がするんだが。
I can't let you drop the show, dude! I need you to know that there's a payoff coming soon!=番組を切らせるわけにはいかないからな。もうじき見応えのあるクライマックスがやってくるってことをお前に教えないと。
I think it's a bad idea to intentionally make the entire first season of your anime really cliche and boring just so that you can surprise people with a "payoff" that comes halfway through.=アニメ1期を意図的に全部ありきたりでつまらなくして、半分過ぎてから「ごほうび」でサプライズを出すってのは良くないと思うんだが。
